Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Data Scientist Intern (165136) Job Description Data Scientist Intern ( Job Number: 165136 ) Cox Enterprises Description Job:  Associate Data Scientist – BI (Intern) Job Description The role of Associate Data Scientist will be responsible for providing analysis of data and creating insights to business problems. This role will develop statistical models, create reports of findings, and create data visualizations.  The analyst will develop an in depth understanding of databases, SQL, SAS and Tableau tools. They will be strong team player with the ability to work and communicate with technical and non-technical resources and customers.  This position requires a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience. This role has no direct reports. Experience with data science. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES · Participate in requirements definition sessions · Perform analysis as required for data driven projects · Assist Project Managers in developing alternative solutions to meet user requirements · Build SAS Data models · Create data visualizations using Tableau · Troubleshoot technical issues Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS: · Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or related field, OR equivalent work experience · Strong analytical skills · SAS or R Skills · The ability to analyze large amounts of data and produce business insight · Proven ability to work at the direction of a lead person but must also possess leadership skills · Ability to meet project deadlines · Ability to manage deliverables and milestones · Strong organizational and analytical skills · Strong verbal and written communication skills · Experience with Tableau data visualization tool and Stats tools Cox Enterprises is a leading communications, media and automotive services company. post_text: Sitecore Developer job - Simple[A] LLC - Atlanta, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Sitecore Developer Simple[A] LLC - Atlanta, GA We're looking for a strong, client-facing Sitecore development lead who works well leading and participating on 100% distributed teams. You'll work with our Sitecore Practice Lead, and other developers to architect and build content management and multi-channel marketing solutions for clients and our agency partners. Experience with Sitecore Experience Database, the enterprise marketing stack, and personalization will go a long way. We prize our ability to consult clients on the strategic use of Sitecore and other digital experience management technology. Most of our Sitecore implementations typically involve some type of integration with third party services, so the ability to think creatively to leverage the strengths of the CMS to make seamless integrations possible is a key requirement. This is a remote position in which you work from your home office, with occasional travel for onsite work with clients and team collaboration. Key Responsibilities: Develop technical specifications based on functional requirements Work with structured content, data template definition and inheritance / content engineering (content modelling, metadata, schema, taxonomy) Develop presentation components Collaborate efficiently with teammates to identify problems and solutions in working toward completion of project goal Direct architecture for security, performance, scale, ux, analytics, optimization Develop integrations to external services and software Author and/or perform tests according to a given test plan and documents results Perform basic debugging in test and production environments Maintain and repair existing properties Sitecore version upgrades Run, maintain agile projects and tickets backlog in JIRA Help facilitate smooth DevOps Collaborate, learn, teach Skills & Requirements Must have: Experienced in Sitecore xDB C#, ASP.NET, .NET MVC, MSSQL Server Great verbal and written communication skills Nice to have: Deep knowledge of Sitecore Experience Platform Years of Experience: 3 or more years Certifications: Sitecore certification In-depth knowledge of IIS and Azure a plus About Simple [A] [A] is a team of intelligent [A]gents made up of smart people with many roles and no titles. We are analysts, programmers, developers, architects, content strategists, strategic consultants, data scientists, producers, marketers, writers and communicators. We work from home offices in the US, Mexico, Latin America and occasionally from other parts of the world. Benefits include a distributed office, training and professional development opportunities, competitive US healthcare plan, 401K, growth and leadership opportunities, and tenure and performance based profit-sharing bonuses. 12 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Simple[A] LLC. title: Data Scientist
summary: The role would also involve testing various machine learning and analytical tools, especially in the big data space, to scale prototypes to production-grade...
post_text:
Data Scientist - Fractal Analytics - Job Board View Our Website View All Jobs Thanks for visiting our Job Board. Please review our open positions and Apply / Refer talent to the positions that closely matches your interest and qualifications. Data Scientist Atlanta, GA Full Time USA Mid Level Share Our Data Sciences’ team needs a hands-on data scientist with the capability to perform independent statistical and ML research and develop & code production-grade novel algorithms. If you are an exceptional data scientist with a zest for exploring new techniques and technologies and are passionate about the science of experimentation, then we would like to talk with you. Responsibilities The role would involve conducting research and prototyping innovations; data and requirements gathering; solution scoping and architecture; consulting clients and client facing teams on advanced statistical and machine learning problems – especially in the areas of marketing and designing experiments. The role would also involve testing various machine learning and analytical tools, especially in the big data space, to scale prototypes to production-grade systems. Familiarity with big data technologies and distributed computing concepts will be an advantage. Qualification & Experience Demonstrable experience designing ML/statistical solutions to complex business problems at scale; developing & testing modular, reusable, efficient and scalable code to implement those solutions. Ideally, this would include the following: High proficiency in concepts and algorithms used in design of experiments. Expert-level proficiency in at least one of R or Python’s (preferred) data science stack. Expert-level proficiency in statistical/ML predictive techniques such as regression, Bayesian methods, tree-based learners, SVM etc. Good to have working experience in one or more of Probabilistic graphical models, Reinforcement learning, NLP and related areas Demonstrable experience of formulating a problem statement and implementing analytical solutions by understanding available data and functional requirements. Thorough grasp on RDBMS and data management concepts as well as fluency in SQL scripting. Fair understanding of distributed computing in multicore and/or clusters, especially using R/Python. Operating knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, especially EMR, EC2, S3, and the AWS CLI). Experience working within a Linux computing environment, and use of command line tools for automating common tasks. Ability to work in a team in an agile setting, familiarity with JIRA and clear understanding of how version control software works, especially Git. In addition, the ideal candidate would have great problem solving skills, and the ability & confidence to hack their way out of tight corners. Education : MS / M.Tech (preferred) or BS / B.Tech. in a field with significant quantitative training such as Statistics, ML, AI, Physics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance etc. Read More Apply for Position Apply for this position Required * Apply with LinkedIn Apply with Indeed Apply with Indeed First Name * Last Name * Email Address * Address Phone * Resume * Attach resume or Paste resume Attach resume ( .pdf, .doc, .docx ) or Paste resume Paste your resume here or Attach resume file Cover Letter How did you hear about this opportunity? * -- No answer -- Online Job Board Recruiting Agency Social Media Alumni Word of Mouth / Friend Campus Recruiting Search Engine Employee Referral If you were referred by an Employee, please mention the full name of the Fractal employee? title: Data Scientist
summary: Machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist, to join our Data...
post_text:
Job posting details.
Data Scientist KPMG Atlanta, GA United States KPMG’s values describe who we are, what we do, and how we do it. The KPMG culture is rooted in our values — it’s a culture of trust and collaboration, flexibility and diversity, where people share knowledge freely and genuinely try to bring out the very best in others. This culture allows you to flourish both as a professional and as an individual — to enjoy a challenging career and get the most from your personal life. Our business services groups consist of professionals with a wide range of skills and backgrounds. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist, to join our Data Analytics team in our Atlanta office with other locations considered.. Responsibilities: Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses Build recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data Cluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and Spark Perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods Drive client engagements focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics, in diverse domains such as product development, marketing research, public policy, optimization, and risk management; communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns Qualifications: Five years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms and ability to work in a Linux environment, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment Masters degree or PhD from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields, with a minimum of two years of relevant experience (strong mathematical background with ability to understand algorithms and methods from a mathematical viewpoint and an intuitive viewpoint) Strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval Strong data extraction and processing, using MapReduce, Pig, and/or Hive preferred Proficiency in analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab) packages, programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, Ruby) as well as the ability to implement, maintain, and troubleshoot big data infrastructure, such as distributed processing paradigms, stream processing and databases such as Hadoop, Storm, SQL and Solr KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. No phone calls or agencies please. One Firm. One Team. Countless Opportunities. KPMG, an equal opportunity employer/disability/veteran. KPMG maintains a drug-free workplace. KPMG will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state or federal law (including San Francisco Ordinance number 131192). Click here to apply for this position. Job code: 59401 48008897

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Training Analytics Data Scientist (160430) Job Description Job : Training / Education Primary Location : United States-Georgia-FC-Atlanta Schedule : Full-time Training Analytics Data Scientist - 160430 Description Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority. Position Overview: The idea of surgical robotics was little more than a curiosity until 1999, the year Intuitive Surgical introduced the da Vinci ® Surgical System.  Today, Intuitive Surgical is the global leader in the rapidly emerging field of robotic-assisted minimally invasive surgery.  Intuitive Surgical is also an industry leader in designing data capture from over 3,000 surgical robotics systems used by over 20,000 surgeons globally. We
are looking for a talented individual to join our growing Enterprise Analytics
team and help to solve the most complex and pressing business problems in our company
and industry. This role has the opportunity to work creatively with a team of
mixed disciplines, while dedicated to the organizations responsible for customer
(surgeon and surgical staff) training as well as hospital program optimization. The primary function of this position is to help
the team measure, control, and optimize its US and international processes and also
influence the improvement of related processes in the training pathway through data
wrangling, curation, analysis and statistical modeling.  The successful
candidate must have a strong curiosity for how our customers learn cutting-edge
technology, insight extraction from data, extreme attention to detail, no fear
of incomplete or messy data, and passion to improve patient outcomes. Roles and Responsibilities: The Professional education
& Program Services (PEPS) Data Scientist participates in problem
formulation and application of analysis and statistical/modeling techniques to
solve business problems and optimize surgical staff training effectiveness. Integrate and become a vital working member of the PEPS and Medical Research team in helping set priorities and strategies, and measurable objectives and performance Deeply understand the customer training process (pre, during and post visiting our training facilities), the collection of training and related data, and the strengths and limitations of these data With the larger PEPS and Medical Research team, and with others in the Analytics Community, work to build a data foundation to measure training pathway effectiveness and PEPS training effectiveness Work deeply and creatively with a cross-functional team to completely revamp training data collection and reports sent to surgeons after they are trained at our training facilities Identify gaps in data capture, help identify how those data can be best captured, and work with IT organization to ensure PEPS applications are instrumented with proper tracking mechanisms to enable analytics. Perform ad-hoc analytics requests, analyze test results, draws actionable insights and presents findings to management to determine and drive training strategy. Work with Intuitive Surgical’s Medical Research team to investigate advances in training methodology and scoring via analytics Work with Intuitive Surgical’s Account Optimization team (Genesis) to identify account performance metrics and areas of optimization. Create and automate on-going analytical reports to sustain program quality and improve efficiency (may work with IT organization for automation). Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to measure customer training effectiveness, and link training effectiveness to post-training customer adoption of Intuitive Surgical’s technology Interpret and present, with team members, statistical model results that lead to business insights, and present findings to management. Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance monitoring systems and operational statistical models. Incorporate disparate data sources that are potentially incomplete and in need of data cleansing. Collaborate with Sales, Sales Ops, Marketing, Finance and various other teams for cross domain analytics. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, including strong presentation skills. Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Data Science or related field. 3+ years of experience in similar role. Strong knowledge of data science concepts (predictive modeling, regression analysis, etc.).  Good knowledge of statistical methods and applications.  Ability to understand cohort analysis beyond “averages”. Experience working with diverse large data sets. Proficiency with programming and data mining/visualization tools such as Hana, SQL, R, SAS/JMP, SPSS and Tableau. Ability to extract and interpret data from various sources. Detail oriented, able to think analytically and use sound judgment, capable of building solutions and solving problems while displaying excellent critical thinking. Background in healthcare or familiarity with surgery is preferred but not required Needs to have a strong interest in the healthcare area, specifically surgical and hospital space Medical robotics has unique characteristics that will require immersion in clinical and technical training and coming up to speed quickly in these areas – an interest and desire to learn are a must Strong organizational skills, ability to meet deadlines in a changing environment and perform multiple tasks effectively and concurrently.  Self-management is important. Ability to build and manage relationships with both internal and external teams. Strong sense of customer service for both internal and external customers.  Chooses team over self. Demonstration of initiative and creativity. Desire to make work fun. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. ©2012 Intuitive Surgical, Inc. All rights reserved. Surgeon List Terms of Use Contact

Apply now × Apply for Job × × × Enter your email to apply Date: Apr 9, 2016 Location: Atlanta, US We all share one big ambition. What’s yours? Everyone who works at UCB holds the same ambition – to transform the lives of people living with severe diseases.  Of course we have other associated ambitions too - including a desire to support each other in attaining all of our own personal and professional goals. That’s why we ensure every UCB colleague has the tools and environment to engage effectively in the work we do. Wherever in the world we’re based, and whatever role we play, we believe each of us can have an impact across our organization. To help us meet our ambitions and provide the best solutions to patients, UCB is currently seeking a talented individual to work as an Advanced Analyst / Data Scientist based at our US Headquarters in suburban Atlanta, Georgia , or at our Global Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium . This individual will be joining the global Commercial Data and Analytics (CDA) team, which is building an Aspirational, Proactive, Entrepreneurial and Patient-Centric team culture. The role of the Advanced Analyst/Data Scientist is to work with commercial data, patient data and other ‘big data’ (e.g., data from social media, distribution channels, insurance/coverage, pharmacies, diagnoses, treatments, outcomes, etc.) to design/develop analyses, deliver insights and translate those insights into valuable commercial solutions for patients and UCB. Key capabilities and accountabilities needed for the role include: Problem-Solving and Solution-Building using advanced analytics and data science tools and techniques, including programming languages, statistical modeling, machine learning and software. Teamwork. Collaborate regularly with commercial executives, members of the CDA team, other advanced analysts and data scientists inside and outside UCB. Partnership. Be the key strategic partner for regional and local commercial stakeholders in the advanced analytics and data science areas. Planning. Work closely with regional and local commercial stakeholders to develop advanced analytics/data science plans, projects and priorities. Execution. Design and execute highly impactful advanced analytics/data science analyses and projects that answer 1) the most compelling business questions and/or 2) identify new opportunities for patients and UCB. In addition, this individual should be able to get the following out of the role: Improve Patient’s Lives. Make a difference to patients by deriving insights that lead to better patient outcomes. Help design and drive our Longitudinal Patient Data (LPD) strategy and deliver analytics and insights that directly impact patients. Tell the story. Use the data and the insights to tell a story. Make complex things simple, understandable and actionable. Learn the business. Gain and then apply a keen understanding of the patients, products, HCPs, other customers, markets, and ecosystems in UCBs areas of focus. Grow your network. Improve your partnership with, and impact on, key internal (UCB) and external stakeholders by interacting directly with patients and/or other external stakeholders (physicians, health care providers, hospitals, payers, etc.) at least four times per year. Expand your horizons. Work on other projects. Lead or help with some global/enterprise-wide analytics or strategic projects Recognition, achievement and compensation in line with your performance and your contributions. Have fun. You will work with a great team in an entrepreneurial and growing biotech company. Preferred Capabilities: Advanced Analytics, Data Science and Quantitative abilities to solve problems and create solutions. Creativity and Innovation. Someone who will come up new ideas and new ways of analyzing data, solving problems and creating solutions. Someone who is comfortable taking new and different approaches and appropriate risks. Teamwork. A good team player. Someone who works well with others, contributes to project teams, delivers her/his responsibilities, then asks “what else can I do?”  Enjoys going “above and beyond.” Communication. Good communication skills, including written, verbal and non-verbal communication. A frequent, pro-active communicator who can make complex concepts simple and actionable. Business Acumen. Someone who understands (or can quickly get up to speed on) the data, data sources, key questions, analytics approaches and the market dynamics of patients and the healthcare and biotech industries. A person who has good intuition who can be both strategic and analytical, who can make connections and see opportunities. Learning Agility. A quick learner; curious. Able to ask the right questions. Comfortable with ambiguity. Ability to process and make connections between different, sometimes ambiguous or contradictory data. Self-awareness. Humility. Aware of strengths, weaknesses and opportunities for growth. Someone who asks for feedback, owns it, and acts on it. Ambition and Passion. Entrepreneurial. Driven to deliver. Self-starter/self-motivated individual who can thrive in a dynamic environment. Someone with a passion for making a difference. Preferred Experiences: Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in a relevant field OR undergraduate degree from a top-tier institution (in a relevant field) with significant additional experience. 4+ years using advanced analytics techniques, statistical tools and software to solve real-world problems. Familiarity and experience with programming languages used in advanced analytics/data science, like (more preferred): Python, R, or Matlab; and/or SAS, JAVA, Julia etc. Experience working with commercial and/or customer data, in any industry, in a quantitative or data-driven role or function. Experience with commercial and/or patient level data in healthcare, insurance, biotech/pharma or other healthcare-related field preferred, but not required. About the team: The Commercial Data and Analytics (CDA) team is a diverse, experienced and talented team made up of Team Leaders, Advanced Analysts/Data Scientists and Analytics and Strategy Leads. We are passionate about life and passionate about what we do. Our backgrounds and work experiences span the globe, from Ecuador to Germany, Belgium to India, Greece to England, and the United States. We have experience in over 15 different industries, including academia, automobile manufacturing, banking, consulting, consumer packaged goods, finance, government, healthcare, internet technology, non-profits/NGOs, software and others. We have degrees in more than 10 fields, from Speech Pathology to Molecular Biology, Psychology to Pharmacy, Management and Applied Economics to Mechanical Engineering The CDA group is led by the VP/Global Head of Commercial Data and Analytics. The VP’s background includes 5 years as a McKinsey consultant; 7 years at Pfizer in roles of increasing responsibility in Marketing, Sales, Strategy, Analytics and Innovation; and experiences as an entrepreneur (3x), venture capitalist, non-profit CEO and U.S. political campaign manager. The VP earned an MBA from Harvard Business School and holds BS in Molecular Biology and a BA in Political Science from Brigham Young University. UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company. We focus on discovering and developing innovative medicines and lateral solutions that can transform the everyday lives of people with severe diseases of the immune system – or the central nervous system. With more than 8500 people in approximately 40 countries, UCB offers an exciting working environment where initiative can flourish and those with a ‘can-do’ attitude can thrive.  Scientific excellence, innovation, co-creation, lateral thinking, reinventing the way we do things…these are some of the key competencies we are constantly developing, and looking for, at UCB. UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Aster Presales Data Scientist (166041) Job Description Aster Presales Data Scientist - 166041 Description Aster Data Center of Innovation at Teradata is looking to expand its sales team with a talented Data Scientist who has proven experience in Big Data analytics. This role provides a challenging opportunity for a self-motivated person with a strong technical background and diverse experience with analytic techniques, enterprise database hardware and software and a track record of delivering solid sales support into large enterprise accounts. Key Responsibilities Assist the Aster COI team with sales activities; including technical evaluations, proof of value (POV) projects, design guidance, installations and prototype/benchmarks both on site at customer locations, and within Aster lab environments Demonstrate Aster’s SQL-MapReduce platform, including SQL-MR library functions and other Aster technologies. Develop and maintain SQL scripts for DDL and data loading to support POC and Sales initiatives Develop demonstrations, presentations, white papers, and other materials as needed to support sales and marketing Work with marketing on related events in assigned territories such as trade shows and webinars and training events Work Environment This is a virtual position for the Eastern US region. Up to 50% travel may required Skills & Attributes Outstanding interpersonal, communication and presentation skills - able to present to senior technical personnel such as CTO, Chief Architect, Lead DBA, Lead Developer, etc. Ability and knowledge in conducting workshops, POC training sessions, and other customer interactive events Proven problem analysis and problem solving skills in the Big Data space, including predictive modeling and machine learning 5+ years of experience working with SQL, Linux, SAS/R. Experience must include the use of scripting languages and at least one programming language with Java being a strong preference Qualifications Basic Qualifications 5+ years of experience with two or more major databases/data warehouses in a DBA, database engineer, or data modeling role. Must be extremely strong at data modeling and query optimization 3+ years of proven success in a sales role, preferably for a database or data warehouse vendor Must be self-motivated and able to work with minimum supervision Preferred Qualifications BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent relevant work experience. Strong Big Data experience required. Aster SQL-MR experience a plus. *Our total compensation approach includes a competitive base salary, 401(k), strong work/family programs, and medical, dental and disability coverage. Teradata is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and commits to hiring returning veterans. post_text: Data Scientist job - The Rainmaker Group - Alpharetta, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Data Scientist The Rainmaker Group - Alpharetta, GA Data Scientist Led by the Customer Service Manager of Pricing and Research, the Customer Service Data Scientist is accountable for understanding business problems to solve, performing data analysis, and providing quantitative solutions. This includes understanding and capturing business needs and requirements, analyzing trends in customer and product data to help the customer service team to provide proactive feedback to customers and the product organizations. Additionally, the Customer Service Data Scientist will operate as a Tier 3 level support analyst and be responsible for analyzing customer requests and communicating the results efficiently to both technical and non-technical audience, supporting and collaborating with the team in making recommendations for backend models of existing products, supporting both internal and external customers with business and/or technical questions. The Customer Service Data Scientist is expected to maintain a high level of professionalism, communicate clearly, and demonstrate a customer-focused attitude and approach to problem solving. Key accountabilities Research Collect and organize data from diverse sources. Develop methods to demonstrate the behavior of the model in response to customer emotions. Perform extensive data analysis to identify and estimate statistical patterns. Analyze customer and product data sets looking for trends that will help the Customer Service team Provide proactive feedback on potential improvements in customer business processes Provide quantitative feedback to the development and science teams on model and forecast behavior Provide recommendations to the product teams for system enhancements based on data analysis and customer feedback Develop analysis tools to reduce case resolution time Research and propose innovations to math models. Help the QA team to verify the results of new math codes. Publish technical articles and blogs. Support Work with customers to understand business processes, problems and needs. Evaluate the quality and performance of mathematical procedures of existing systems. Provide support for the implementation team to setup new math components. Provide support for the support team to answer the 3rd level pricing questions. Formulate and prototype segmentation/clustering, prediction and optimization models. Evaluate and explain math designs to the product team and QA team. qualifications & experience A MS degree is required in one of the following quantitative disciplines: Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics or related fields. A PhD degree is a plus. Minimum of 2 years hands-on experience in performing data analysis including manipulating large and diverse data, cleaning data, and estimating statistical models. Strong knowledge of data mining and machine learning techniques such as decision tree (CHAID/CART), clustering, segmentation, association rules, etc. Familiar with statistical models such as generalized linear regression, discrete choice model, etc. Familiar with unconstrained and constrained optimization modeling using CPLEX, etc. Must be able to independently research academic and practitioner literatures in order to apply the most suitable technique to the problems. Hands-on experience using three or more languages like SQL/EXCEL, S-plus/R, SPSS/SAS, Python, C++/C#, etc. Experience in modeling and implementing Pricing and Revenue Management systems is highly desirable. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Proven ability to work well in a team environment and under pressure. summary: Machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval. Five years of professional experience working as a Data...
post_text:
Job posting details.
Sr Associate Data Scientist, Big Data KPMG Atlanta, GA United States KPMG’s values describe who we are, what we do, and how we do it. The KPMG culture is rooted in our values — it’s a culture of trust and collaboration, flexibility and diversity, where people share knowledge freely and genuinely try to bring out the very best in others. This culture allows you to flourish both as a professional and as an individual — to enjoy a challenging career and get the most from your personal life. Our business services groups consist of professionals with a wide range of skills and backgrounds. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist, to join us in any major US city with a KPMG office. Responsibilities: Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses Build recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data Cluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and Spark Perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods Drive client engagements focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics, in diverse domains such as product development, marketing research, public policy, optimization, and risk management; communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns Qualifications: Five years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms and ability to work in a Linux environment, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment Masters degree or PhD from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields, with a minimum of two years of relevant experience (strong mathematical background with ability to understand algorithms and methods from a mathematical viewpoint and an intuitive viewpoint) Strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval Strong data extraction and processing, using MapReduce, Pig, and/or Hive preferred Proficiency in analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab) packages, programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, Ruby) as well as the ability to implement, maintain, and troubleshoot big data infrastructure, such as distributed processing paradigms, stream processing and databases such as Hadoop, Storm, SQL and Solr KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. No phone calls or agencies please. One Firm. One Team. Countless Opportunities. KPMG, an equal opportunity employer/disability/veteran. KPMG maintains a drug-free workplace. KPMG will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state or federal law (including San Francisco Ordinance number 131192). Date: Apr 12, 2016 Location: Atlanta, GA, US Company: SunTrust Statistical Quantitative Analyst 3-264667 Description • Responsible for modeling & building portfolio strategies and quantitative analytics around the entire spectrum of mortgage and consumer products. • Build, manage, maintain and improve various models that assist in the valuation and forecasting process. Perform complex analysis and modeling. • Provide analytical support for strategic business decisions, using multiple scenario/strategy combinations within a stochastic and deterministic framework. • Use econometric modeling techniques to create base forecasts along with forecasts under CCAR, DFAST, and idiosyncratic stresses. • Apply advanced statistical concepts and performing quantitative analysis that assists in the measuring, monitoring and managing portfolio risk. • Design and create management reporting dashboards and processes. • Clearly define and document requirements, processes, methodologies that are needed to develop and support Risk Management systems/models. • Work closely with Treasury, Credit, default, loss mitigation, market risk and secondary market groups within the bank. • Develop and/or analyze quantitative models. • Research best practices and new technologies. Perform complex analysis and draws conclusions. • May oversee or assist less experienced analysts. Qualifications • Must have a Master’s degree in Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Statistics or other related quantitative field • Must have two years of experience in statistical or quantitative analysis positions. • Work or educational background must include experience with: • Performing statistical and quantitative analysis; • Programming in VBA, C++, and/or Java as applied to statistical models and forecasting; • Utilizing experience with SQL and SAS to support quantitative analysis; • Excel, Word and Power Point; • Probability and Statistics; • Risk management for financial institutions, including banking and interest rate risk management, credit analysis, and hedging; • Financial Analysis (including time value of money, term structures, interest compounding, and yield curve); • Utilizing knowledge of fixed income analytics and/or mortgage banking; • Applying knowledge of option adjusted spread (OAS), duration, negative convexity, Monte Carlo simulation, yield curve, interest rate risk concepts, and factors affecting prepayment; • Building and maintaining models and ad hoc analytics & reporting; and • Building and managing complex processes. Apply now × Apply for Job × × × Enter your email to apply Date: Apr 3, 2016 Location: Atlanta, US We all share one big ambition. What’s yours? Everyone who works at UCB holds the same ambition – to transform the lives of people living with severe diseases.  Of course we have other associated ambitions too - including a desire to support each other in attaining all of our own personal and professional goals. That’s why we ensure every UCB colleague has the tools and environment to engage effectively in the work we do. Wherever in the world we’re based, and whatever role we play, we believe each of us can have an impact across our organization. We have big plans, and it starts with great people. If you get excited about our mission and love fetching, analyzing and presenting data, there might be a job for you. Be part of a true Data Science team About Us We translate the science of big data into patient-centric solutions Perspective Matters When we look at data, we always start from the same question: how will this make a difference to the lives of people living with severe diseases? For every UCB practice we support - from marketing to patient solutions teams - we apply perspective to big data so that we can bring the right insights and information for any solution. Data Tells a Story Patient data tells a rich contextual story about what it means to live with a severe disease. Focused analyses of big data provide powerful insights into what's matters most, while also revealing how UCB can deliver greater value to the patients we make a difference for. Insights Through Technology Getting the right data means using technologies that can source insightful and relevant information. Through securing strategic partnerships with analytics leaders, top research universities, and innovative startups, we have established a robust technology ecosystem Simplify the Complex We help transform challenges into opportunities. From patients, to health practitioners, caregivers, and loved ones, we use our Advanced Analytics capabilities to help bring UCB's future of patient-centric experiences and solutions to life in innovative ways. About the Job You will be part of a team of passionate data science experts and play a key role in the development of innovative data solutions What you’ll do Design, compose, program, pipelines and apps covering data acquisition, machine learning, visualizations and signal processing Manage projects with multiple stakeholders globally (mainly US and Europe) Drive the adoption of novel data science approaches through prototyping and engaging with the community Embrace our patient value principles What you need Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Business Administration, Computer Sciences or closely related fields with extensive knowledge in the application of statistics and computer sciences. 5+ years of experience using statistical insights and software to solve real-world problems Experience with Python, R or Matlab Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment Proven entrepreneurial and self-management skills What you’ll get Opportunity to work in a startup-like environment Partnering with other experienced data scientists Opportunity to travel frequently to our European HQ Access to cutting-edge technology Recognition for excellent work and compensation in line with your performance UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company. We focus on discovering and developing innovative medicines and lateral solutions that can transform the everyday lives of people with severe diseases of the immune system – or the central nervous system. With more than 8500 people in approximately 40 countries, UCB offers an exciting working environment where initiative can flourish and those with a ‘can-do’ attitude can thrive.  Scientific excellence, innovation, co-creation, lateral thinking, reinventing the way we do things…these are some of the key competencies we are constantly developing, and looking for, at UCB. UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Data Analytic Scientist (ES) - New New
summary: As Wikipedia states ”Data Scientist have the ability to find and interpret rich data sources, manage large amounts of data despite hardware, software and...
post_text: Data Analytic Scientist (ES) - New New job - Delanecs - Alpharetta, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Data Analytic Scientist (ES) - New New Delanecs - Alpharetta, GA *Position: Data Analytic Scientist (ES) New New * Location: Alpharetta, GA and Lake Mary, FL Duration: Direct Hire Support roles are critical to the success of every function at Verizon. Enjoy the challenge of bringing organization and efficiency to a variety of global, cross-functional projects. Responsibilities Verizon Communications Inc. is a global leader in delivering broadband and other wireless and wireline communications services to mass market, business, government and wholesale customers. A Dow 30 company, Verizon employs a diverse workforce of more than 194,000 and last year generated consolidated revenues of $106.6 billion. The Senior Manager Business Intelligence – Junior Data Scientist of Risk Analytics will be part of an objective assurance and consulting team that is independently managed within Verizon Communications designed to add value and improve operations. The Internal Audit team assists the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors and Verizon management in accomplishing their objectives by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of the overall control environment, risk management, and governance processes. The Internal Audit staff gains extensive exposure to diverse aspects of Verizon's business. These risk assessment assignments include increasing levels of responsibilities and presentations to senior management, making Internal Audit an excellent place to work for high potential employees. Have you read Malcolm Gladwell’s books? Or the string of other authors solving business challenges through Data mining? Are you interested in a path to becoming a data scientist? Do you have what it takes to develop great business acumen? Leverage your critical thinking and problem solving skills while leveraging technical tools to analyze large complex data sets? Are you self driven? If so then these responsibilities could be yours. As Wikipedia states ”Data Scientist have the ability to find and interpret rich data sources, manage large amounts of data despite hardware, software and bandwidth constraints, merge data sources together, ensure consistency of data-sets, create visualizations to aid in understanding data and building rich tools that enable others to work effectively.” Responsibilities Lead and manage high performance forensic analytics auditing team in its drive to improve business intelligence to identify risk, minimize business impact from audit fatigue and assist in enhancing the audit process through data. Enhance the team’s ability to increase risk coverage through the business by utilizing transaction analysis, control monitoring, and fraud detection. Build efforts to identify and mitigate fraud, misconduct and control gaps through data mining. People Passion for growth and learning new techniques with vigor and enthusiasm. Strong manager with top notch team collaboration skills. Working with the team of four peers with over 40 years of data warehousing, programming, data mining, software design and project management experience. Coordinate with business to ensure follow-up and resolution of exceptions including specific individual resolution as well as root-cause analysis and control gap identification. Develop team’s training plan and take part in training courses to increase skill set and technical capabilities in order to better serve the needs of the analytics team. Lead a proactive fraud detection team working on forensics and business intelligence and implementation of strategies, plans, objectives, procedures and priorities that will assist the team in achieving its mission. Lead and coordinate efforts between fraud, finance, VZW and compliance teams; direct and evolve risk ownership. Build relationships with the business, identify areas to add value by using forensic business intelligence to mitigate risk exposure to the business Actively participates in the completion of department technology initiatives to support the development of a best-in-class Internal Audit function through risk analytics. Lead Audits and Data Risk Models that improve and create a the data analytics culture within the business. Provide direction and reporting review, oversight and approval to team of Consultants on audit assist, data risk models, continuous monitoring or ad hoc data mining project requests Liaise with Audit department leadership, business management, and other stakeholders, including Corporate Security, Legal, Finance, External Reporting and HQ/Area Compliance, with respect to findings, strategic direction, and enterprise risk management. Lead and Manage the individual performance of team members on site and remotely as well as assisting with the development of the careers of the team members. Manage and plan for the future development of the department. Process Strong ability to independently and proactively initiate projects, hypothesize business transaction flows and fraudulent scenarios. Strong project management capabilities and skills. Design, develop, maintain and communicate visual dashboards. Design and develop ad-hoc analysis based on “loose” business requirement needs as well as uncover the needs of the business, driving results. Identify and use appropriate investigative and analytical technologies to interpret and verify results. Direct and coordinate the process to extract, normalize, analyze, review and report with respect to data efforts related to continuous auditing/monitoring activities. Review large software implementations to identify transaction flow gaps, design flaws and data integrity issues. Technology Design, extract, normalize, analyze, review and automate analysis for Internal Audit utilizing enterprise data warehouse, extracts and data mining tools; coordinate with business for outside data source requirements. Maintain databases and related programs in a thorough and efficient manner. Direct the identification and use of appropriate analytical technologies. Deep Knowledge of the Teradata Verizon Wireless Datawarehouse a plus. Software implementation, troubleshooting and program design. Learn the technology that shapes our business to help reshape our future. Qualifications Requires a BA/BS in business and a minimum of 4-5 years of related auditing, accounting, information technology and or finance experience. MBA, Masters, CISSP, PMP, CPA, CEH and or CFE designation preferred 2-3 years of prior management experience Experience in using and managing forensic technologies, including computer forensics and data analysis and mining tools preferred. Advanced MS Excel. Working knowledge of SQL server, Teradata, IDEA, Hadoop, or vb script preferred. Strong understanding of risk management methodology and factors Prior investigative experience within telecommunications sector as well as general fraud risk management experience. Strong business analytical skills a must; ability to apply business logic to design and implement risk models and standard reporting. Ability to interpret business requests as well as communicate findings in a user-friendly manner Demonstrated ability to lead a team in a fast changing environment with changing priorities and changing time constraints across all of the Verizon business units Strong interpersonal skills and ability to multi-task Excellent communication and negotiation skills Ability to write clear, concise reports and strong ability to orally communicate effectively Minimal travel required < 15% Required experience: Data Warehouse: 5 years 5 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Delanecs. Statistician I  - AlphaProTemps, A.P.R., Inc. "Bridging Clients With Certified Professionals And 

    Unparalleled Customer Service Team" Serving Clients and our Community. "Since 1993" AlphaProTemps A. 

    P. R., Inc. Openings >> Statistician I Statistician I Summary Title: Statistician I ID: KC5464423 Labor Type: Contract (W2 only) Posting #: KC5464423 Location: Roswell, GA Compensation: $37/HR Description POSITION SUMMARY The Statistician supports project learning by designing experiments that efficiently and effectively address project needs and analyzing/interpreting results. They consult with other statisticians within the department and work with test method development scientists to understand method intention and guide method evaluation. KEY CUSTOMERS: Sector Management, Project Sponsors, R&E project teams, External Technical Consultants, and Technical Service Providers CUSTOMER EXPECTATIONS: •Partner with R&E project teams to design experiments to efficiently evaluate product characteristics utilizing appropriate testing methods. •Utilize creative approaches in designing, analyzing and interpreting experiments. Contribute to discussions regarding interpretation and next steps. •Document method development and product evaluation experiments in interpretive reports. •Understand and effectively use the systems and tools utilized to process and analyze data from product research testing •Carry out project responsibility with limited assistance and direction •Carry out all work ensuring effective Safety and Quality attitudes and practices. •Implement projects and programs with excellence to deliver research project objectives. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: •Advanced degree (Master’s) in Statistics related major / discipline •0-3 years of work experience utilizing Advanced Statistics methods •Successful engagement in team-oriented environment to successfully deliver business results PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: •Demonstrated ability of writing and presenting updates to leadership. •Specific experience designing and analyzing bench testing of non-food consumer products CRITICAL SKILLS: •Understanding of statistical analysis methods and experimental design and ability to transform statistical results into actionable knowledge. •Proficiency with SAS. •Ability to synthesize information across recent and historical testing. •Ability to explain complex information in a simple to understand way – written and verbal – within project teams and at times in non-technical settings. •Strong knowledge and demonstrated ability in translating product development project needs into experimental design. •Ability to contribute innovative ideas in a team environment. •Effective Communication Skills with the ability to discuss technical issues in a business environment (research project teams, suppliers, management, etc.). Flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing business priorities and assignments. •Application/Results orientation with primary focus on problem definition and generation of alternative solutions. •Customer Focus when dealing with internal and external customers. •Demonstrated experience effectively following engineering procedures and processes. title: Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader
summary: The Commercial Data and Analytics (CDA) team is a diverse, experienced and talented team made up of Team Leaders, Advanced Analysts/Data Scientists and...
post_text: Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader close Notice about cookies Notice about cookies: This website uses a limited number of cookies to improve your browsing experience. For further information (including how to withdraw consent), please refer to our Cookie Policy . By clicking Accept below or continuing to use this website (including closing this message), you confirm that you have read and consent to our use of cookies as detailed in our Cookie Policy . Accept UCB on LinkedIn Featured Careers Pharmaceutical Medical Careers Scientific Careers Sales and Marketing Corporate Careers Sign in Our Company Search by Keyword Search by Location Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader Apply now » Apply now Start apply with LinkedIn Start apply with Facebook Apply Now Email Start Please wait... Apply now × Apply for Job × × × Enter your email to apply Date: Apr 3, 2016 Location: Atlanta, US We all share one big ambition. What’s yours? Everyone who works at UCB holds the same ambition – to transform the lives of people living with severe diseases.  Of course we have other associated ambitions too - including a desire to support each other in attaining all of our own personal and professional goals. That’s why we ensure every UCB colleague has the tools and environment to engage effectively in the work we do. Wherever in the world we’re based, and whatever role we play, we believe each of us can have an impact across our organization. UCB has a dynamic culture focused on creating value for patients. As a company, we are dedicated to upholding and improving our culture by living our Patient Value Strategy principles: moving from Task to Value, Noise to Signal, creating Space with Consistency, and acting with Helpfulness and Generosity. To help us meet our ambitions and provide the best solutions to patients, UCB is currently seeking a talented individual as Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader based at our US Headquarters in suburban Atlanta, Georgia , or at our Global Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium .  This individual will be joining the global Commercial Data and Analytics (CDA) team, which is focused on being Aspirational, Proactive, Entrepreneurial and Patient-Centric. The mission of this role is to Deliver Insights that Create Patient Value. Key capabilities and accountabilities needed for the Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader include: Leadership. Strategic Leadership . Set the agenda and provide strategic leadership across the commercial data and analytics “value chain”. Team Leadership . Lead a team of 2-4 direct reports, and an organization of 5 to 20 people (including vendors and contractors).  Also, lead cross-functional project teams that deliver key projects and initiatives across UCB. Partnership and Collaboration. Be the key strategic partner for regional and local commercial stakeholders and co-create plans and priorities for data and analytics with them. Execution. Drive the execution of regional and local data analytics plans and priorities. Deliver the most impactful data and analytics projects that: 1) address the most compelling business questions, and/or 2) identify new opportunities for patients and UCB. On a day-to-day basis, this individual should focus her/his efforts on one (or two) local/regional Patient Value Unit(s) (PVU; a business unit which is focused on a single therapeutic area). She/he should: Collaborate with key executives in her/his assigned PVU(s), including the GM, business leads, brand teams and finance/controllers. Partner with these key executives to ask the right questions, and then deliver insights—through data and analytics—that have significant impact on patients’ lives and create value for both patients and UCB. Gain and then apply a keen understanding of the patients, products, HCPs, other customers, markets, and ecosystems of your assigned therapeutic area(s) or PVU(s). Drive our Longitudinal Patient Data (LPD) strategy and deliver analytics and insights that directly impact patients. Evaluate commercial or promotional spend within the PVU(s) and deliver insights to improve resource allocation and drive patient value. Improve our team’s partnership with, and impact on, key internal (UCB) and external stakeholders by: developing and executing a communication and collaboration plan with key UCB stakeholders; improving her/his knowledge and the CDA team’s knowledge of the business by ensuring that she/he and each CDA team member has direct interaction with patients and/or other external stakeholders at least four times per year. Attract, retain, motivate and develop key talent for the CDA team; coach and develop team members. In addition, the Commercial Data and Analytics Team Leader should expect to able to: Lead the work done by business analysts and advanced analysts/data scientists. Help design, then lead or manage advanced analytics/data science projects and initiatives. Lead, manage or provide input to the global and/or regional forecasting models and forecasting process. Gain a deep understand the Gross-to-Net (G2N) process of the PVU (especially if assigned to a US PVU) and provide guidance, as needed. Lead some global/enterprise-wide projects, which may include: Re-designing or improving the data and analytics value chain* for UCB (*this includes: data, data infrastructure and integration, sales operations, reporting, basic analytics, advanced analytics); Improving UCBs forecasting processes; Improving the commercial reports and reporting systems; Creating an enterprise wide data strategy and/or analytics strategy, including data and analytics governance; and, Other key strategic projects or initiatives. Preferred Capabilities: Executive Presence. Strong and confident presence. A peer to and an intellectual and strategic “sparring partner” with UCB senior executives. Leadership and Coaching. A good coach; skilled at identifying and developing talent, and leading a team. Has the confidence to hire people who are smarter and more skilled they he/she may be. Skilled at motivating, praising and giving clear, actionable feedback (both appreciative and constructive) to direct reports, peers and more senior leaders. Communication. A clear, thorough and practical communicator with strong written, verbal and non-verbal communication skills. Someone who communicates frequently and proactively, who is skilled at telling a story and making complex concepts simple and actionable. Ability to build and deliver coherent storylines in powerpoint, and deliver clear, structured verbal messages while making presentations. Business Acumen. Good intuition. Strategic and Analytical. Good at analyzing businesses and competitors, making connections and seeing opportunities. Someone who understands (or can quickly get up to speed on) the market dynamics and details of patients and the biotech and healthcare industries. Innovation. Someone who proverbially “thinks outside of the box.”  Comes up new ideas and guides teams to be innovative. Has successful track record of leading and influencing individuals, teams and organizations to move beyond typical approaches and take appropriate risks. Learning Agility. A quick learner; curious. Able to ask the right questions. Comfortable with ambiguity. Ability to process and make connections between different, sometimes ambiguous or contradictory data. Self-awareness. Humility. Aware of strengths, weaknesses and opportunities for growth. Someone who asks for feedback, owns it, and acts on it. Focused. Decisive. Someone who can make decisions quickly. Ability to help teams and senior executives prioritize ideas, distilling them into strategies and tactics that can be executed by UCB to create more patient value. Ambition. Driven to deliver. Self-starter/self-motivated. Has the ability and desire to become a more senior leader at UCB within the next 18-36 months. Preferred Experiences: 5+ years and ideally 10+ years total work experience. Some experience in biotech/pharma or healthcare preferred, but not required. Experience from other industries strongly encouraged. These may include: Experience at a top-tier consulting firm, with some experience in healthcare and/or pharmaceuticals. (Candidates coming directly from consulting firms should have at least one year of experience, and preferably more, at the Engagement Manager/Team Leader/Project Manager level or above); Experience in strategy, marketing, sales, data science, analytics, innovation or other quantitative or data-driven roles or functions; Experience in fast-paced teams and/or entrepreneurial environments in any of the following industries: technology, consumer electronics, internet/web, consumer packaged goods, retail, finance/banking, investment banking, private equity, venture capital, hedge funds, insurance, healthcare, energy or other. Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in engineering, a biological, physical or social science, advanced analytics/data science, strategy or innovation OR an MBA from a top tier institution with significant experience. About the team and the role: The Commercial Data and Analytics (CDA) team is a diverse, experienced and talented team made up of Team Leaders, Advanced Analysts/Data Scientists and Analytics and Strategy Leads. We are passionate about life and passionate about what we do. Our backgrounds and work experiences span the globe, from Ecuador to Germany, Belgium to India, Greece to England, and the United States. We have experience in over 15 different industries, including academia, automobile manufacturing, banking, consulting, consumer packaged goods, finance, government, healthcare, internet technology, non-profits/NGOs, software and others. We have degrees in more than 10 fields, from Speech Pathology to Molecular Biology, Psychology to Pharmacy, Management and Applied Economics to Mechanical Engineering The CDA group is led by the VP/Global Head of Commercial Data and Analytics. The VP’s background includes 5 years as a McKinsey consultant; 7 years at Pfizer in roles of increasing responsibility in Marketing, Sales, Strategy, Analytics and Innovation; and experiences as an entrepreneur (3x), venture capitalist, non-profit CEO and U.S. political campaign manager. The VP earned an MBA from Harvard Business School and holds BS in Molecular Biology and a BA in Political Science from Brigham Young University. Nearest Major Market: Atlanta Job Segment: Database, Analytics, Pathology, Data Analyst, Biotech, Technology, Management, Healthcare, Data, Science Apply now » Apply now Start apply with LinkedIn Start apply with Facebook Apply Now Email Start Please wait... title: Marketing Research Analyst
summary: Applies essential research design principles (pretesting, upfront analysis planning, and creating rational and achievable project plans);...
post_text: UPS Careers: Profile Assistant UPS - Career Click here to Skip to main content Menu UPS United States Jobs Search Jobs Now Go Home About UPS Career Areas Working At UPS Select Another Location Advanced Job Search Contact Us FAQ Media My Application & Employment Forms Requisition Inquiry Marketing Research Analyst DETAILS: Requisition #: 201088723 Job Category: Marketing Operation: New Product/CTM/Research Job Group: FT Supervisor Job Grade: 20G Job Code: 0887 Relocation Assist Available: No Location: ATLANTA, GA 30328 - UPS CORPORATE OFFICES JOB DESCRIPTION: Job Summary The Marketing Research Analyst determines and recommends the appropriate method of research to investigate specific business issues or problems. He/she designs research studies to collect customer information for use in the identification and analysis of customer solutions. The Marketing Research Analyst II consults with internal subject matter experts and third-party research vendors to assist in identifying the best approach to solving business issues. He/she determines and collects the relevant data required to perform analyses and is also responsible for summarizing and communicating the results of the analyses to key stakeholders throughout the organization. The Marketing Research Analyst supervises specialists. The Marketing Research Analyst maintains an understanding of current market and industry practices to leverage existing knowledge and optimize development of customer analyses. He/She develops analysis objectives to better understand customer needs and identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience. This position formats databases to run queries and generate reports for inclusion in presentations. He/She maintains subject matter expertise across vendor offerings, research methods, and marketplace activities to optimize UPS’s use of third-party vendors. The Marketing Research Analyst also manages project lifecycles, including project scope, resources, schedule, initiation, start-up/design, building, and deployment to see projects from beginning-to-end. Other Duties Gathers customer and/or third-party data from internal sources (e.g., Business Development, Marketing Research Department, etc.) for use in marketing research projects. Performs analyses using statistical software (e.g., Statistical Package for the Social Sciences) to facilitate understanding and interpretation of data. Gathers, compiles, and sorts data to facilitate reporting and analysis. Writes Requests for Proposals to facilitate vendors’ understanding of UPS’s expected project deliverables. Monitors production of data collection to stay within budget and ensure the project is completed on schedule. Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals. Designs methods to capture needed market research data to identify market, segmentation and research objectives. Completes competitive assessment of industry landscape to understand competitors’ capabilities and solutions. Makes recommendations on research methodology, based on results of preliminary analyses, to assist stakeholders in the achievement of business goals and objectives. Proactively addresses stakeholder concerns to facilitate understanding of any risks and benefits associated with the research methodology. Preferred Competencies Applies Information Analysis & Solution Generation Knowledge: Identifies key information sources, assesses information quality, understands, and communicates limitations; relates and compares information from different sources; manages large amounts of data and appropriately applies data reduction and exploratory analysis techniques; makes logical assumptions; challenges own findings and documents process and outcomes; audits own analyses and determines their validity. Applies Problem Definition & Structuring Knowledge: Identifies key factors behind basic problems and establish a path to solve them; proposes approaches to solve more complicated problems; investigates and diagnoses anomalies in routine business results. Applies Service, Product, and Customer Technology Knowledge: Demonstrates a basic understanding of products, services, and customer facing technology solutions offered by UPS along with their features and business applications; describes general customer profiles targeted by the company. Develops and Manages Marketing Research: Clearly defines research objectives and key questions; designs research projects using common qualitative and quantitative marketing research methods; applies essential research design principles (pretesting, upfront analysis planning, and creating rational and achievable project plans); differentiates between strong and weak insights and acts accordingly; interprets and uses research results objectively. Project Management: Demonstrates understanding of implementation objectives, project plan, and one's role within a project; participates in the implementation of a project; provides timely, thorough and concise updates for area of responsibility; identifies areas of risk and properly communicates them to the project manager. Project Planning: Demonstrates an understanding of basic project planning processes, including planning action items and resources. Statistical Analysis: Demonstrates some advanced knowledge of statistical analyses, sampling, and tests; demonstrates the ability to identify outliers in data sets; troubleshoots existing statistical models; demonstrates basic knowledge of time series analysis. Minimum Qualifiers Master's degree in Social Science, Statistics, or Marketing ~ Preferred BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Must be a U.S. Citizen or National of the U.S., an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. for this employer. Employer will not sponsor visas for this or future positions. Must be in the same geographic location as the job or willing to relocate yourself there. Must have a Bachelor’s degree (or internationally comparable degree) or be a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience. Must have some advanced knowlege of statistical analysis. Must have experience developing marketing research projects (analyzing results, and formulating insights) to address business issues to help guide decisions. Must have experience with applying information analysis (i.e. managing large amounts of data and conducting exploratory data analysis) to generate solutions. OTHER CRITERIA: Employer will not sponsor visas for position. UPS is an equal opportunity employer – race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/sexual orientation/gender identity. Manager - Data Scientist, Big Data KPMG Atlanta, GA United States KPMG is proud to foster a high-performance culture, one that’s defined by having the best people, with the skills and determination to deliver above and beyond. We look for insightful and astute professionals who are also forward-thinking, confident, and globally minded. Our business services groups consist of professionals with a wide range of skills and backgrounds. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist, to join us in any major US city with a KPMG office. Responsibilities: Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses Build recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data Cluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and Spark Perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods Drive client engagements focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics, in diverse domains such as product development, marketing research, public policy, optimization, and risk management; Communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns Qualifications: Eight years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms and ability to work in a Linux environment, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment Masters degree or PhD from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields, with a minimum of two years of relevant experience (strong mathematical background with ability to understand algorithms and methods from a mathematical viewpoint and an intuitive viewpoint) Strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval Strong data extraction and processing, using MapReduce, Pig, and/or Hive preferred Proficiency in analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab) packages, programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, Ruby) as well as the ability to implement, maintain, and troubleshoot big data infrastructure, such as distributed processing paradigms, stream processing and databases such as Hadoop, Storm, SQL and Solr KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package.
