title: Staff Research Scientist V: Materials Researcher
summary: With the minimum of two years of experience in the disciplines of Applied Mathematics, General Physics, Computational Physics, Chemical/Nuclear Engineering or...
post_text: The Hexagon Lavish Staff Research Scientist V: Materials Researcher | SmartRecruiters Staff Research Scientist V: Materials Researcher Atlanta , GA Full-time Company Description Hexagon Lavish is a scientific R&D/high-tech startup based in Atlanta, Georgia. It was founded by Desmond J. Watson in 2010. The company initially was focused in machine learning techniques but now has evolved into a small company that's devoted to utilizing "unorthodox" research methodologies in theoretical development and non-compromised use of mathematics and science. As of right now, Desmond J. Watson , Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Hexagon Lavish , is putting together a small team of researchers, mathematicians, engineers and programmers for this startup. If you're interested in applying your skills in efforts of turning ideas into a grand journey, submit your CV/résumé today. Job Description Hexagon Lavish is a scientific R&D/high-tech startup based in Atlanta, Georgia that has an opening full-time/permanent position for an experienced SRS V: Materials Researcher who will direct an engaging focus in conducting research in the application of PIR Beta implementation techniques for "smart devices" such as "smartphones", "wearables" and "smart home appliances/devices". The SRS V: Materials Researcher will play as the medium between those on the PIR Beta team and the PIR Omega team. The SRS V: Materials Researcher will also need to hone skills in thermoelectric/heat diffusion and using their results in the design, development, testing and deployment of the resultant software infrastructure known as C.S.N. ( Consequential Systems Neutralization ), however, they will also engage in research determining the geometrics of certain materials such as the " shape of a plate " for the PIR: Premier Information Retrieval® . The C.S.N. system will provide scalable and computable resources to scientists at Hexagon Lavish and around the world. This is an opportunity to work on a software platform with significant impact on general physics research and to work in a semi-fast paced entrepreneurial environment. This position will also focus on the development of C.S.N.’s client-side integration with data analysis tools like Matlab, Labview and R; having a general understanding of core data structures as they pertain to that of a matrix; mathematical/scientific programming; bottleneck and content analysis; Taylor’s approximation and dimensional Fourier law; and the ability to work with standard heat equations. The candidate will be expected to be able to work both independently and along with a small, interdisciplinary team supporting scientific end users that utilize the C.S.N. software platform. The SRS V: Materials Researcher will report weekly to the Chief Science Officer . Qualifications Requirements • Ph.D. with the minimum of two years of experience in the disciplines of Applied Mathematics, General Physics, Computational Physics, Chemical/Nuclear Engineering or Statistics OR Master's with the minimum of three years of experience in the disciplines of Applied Mathematics, General Physics, Computational Physics, Chemical/Nuclear Engineering or Statistics OR Bachelor's with the minimum of five years of experience in the disciplines of Applied Mathematics, General Physics, Computational Physics, Chemical/Nuclear Engineering or Statistics • Strong programming skills and demonstrable ability to work with a variety of programming languages (high-level language (Java), low-level language (C/C++), etc) • Background in data analysis, machine learning and statistics is beneficial • Familiarity with software development tools (Bloodshed Dev++ IDE for C/C++, Eclipse for Java development, Maven) • Ability to work with standard heat equations/modeling with differential equations • Must be able to maintain unconditional stability with the Crank-Nicholson numerical method • Working with and/or developing software tools used primarily by academic/scientific communities • Must be able to deliver high-quality, high-level code for scientific applications and development of mathematical tools • Design systems and benchmarks for validation • Provide written documentation • Apply rapid prototyping concepts to solution development • Participate in brainstorming sessions • Adaptable to a scientific research environment Candidate must be a U.S. citizen Additional Information Essential Job Functions • This is a scientific research position • Take theory, apply it to different situations, watch the outcomes and then manipulate that theory after seeing the implications • Build models, refine and improve on models • Partner up with external experts in the field • Advise on the technical/algorithmic feasibility of emerging ideas and solutions • The candidate for this position will be working with high performance computing applications, runtimes and system software (MPI, PGAS, etc.) • High performance computer interconnects • Experience with code written in Fortran Non-essential Job Functions • Mentor entry-level researchers in physics applications conducive to the working environment • Work closely with the Chief Science Officer in Applied Mathematics, General Physics, Computational Physics, Chemical/Nuclear Engineering, etc. • Be available to attend monthly meetups • Be willing to attend annual conferences, conventions, meetings, etc. Other Skills/Abilities • Fluent in English • Experience with Eigen is desired • Comfortable with Fortran is desired • A candidate with the ability to distinguish nonlinear behavior is desired • Must be comfortable working alongside scientists, engineers and programmers in order to collaborate on ideas and the fulfillment of objectives • A willingness to engage in conversation with others concerning technical attributes pertaining to subject matter relative to objectives of the job description Hexagon Lavish is an equal opportunity employer . Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Urban Planner (BI 00005D) Job Description Urban Planner - ( BI 00005D ) Description The Buildings & Infrastructure (B&I) Line of Business is a global network of approximately 11,500 employees, which serves both the private and public sector.   Our employees work to shape the communities we live in by creating world-class projects that transform the future development patterns of those communities.  We provide our clients award-winning planning, engineering, architectural and interior design, construction and program management, and design-build project delivery.    The Jacobs business model allows us to successfully service our clients, leverage our integrated services, and provide our employees with growth opportunities while delivering global solutions to our client’s local programs. We consistently receive high rankings from Engineering News-Record (ENR) in many classifications, including the categories of Top Design Firms, Top Contractors, Top Green Buildings Design Firms, and Top Transportation Companies. The Advance Planning Group (APG) within Jacobs is a premier provider of facility planning/programming and consulting services to a variety of government, institutional, military, and corporate clients. These services include feasibility studies, project development studies, design guidelines, facility master plans, workplace strategies, visioning sessions, portfolio strategies, and real estate advisory services meant to enhance our clients’ business efficiencies. APG includes professionals within three specific service lines - Facility Strategies, Urban Design and Planning, and Visual Media. The APG team includes facility programmers, architects, interior designers, engineers, business analysts, workplace strategists, planners, landscape architects, graphic designers, and other related disciplines. Performs routine aspects of urban planning assignments applying knowledge of basic urban planning principles under close supervision. Typically receives instructions from and works under the direction of a senior level Planner. Develops plans for utilization of land and physical facilities of cities, counties, and metropolitan areas, applying diverse knowledge of planning principles and practices. Compiles and analyzes data on economic, social, and physical factors affecting land use, and prepares or requisitions graphic and narrative reports on data. Confers with local authorities, civic leaders, social scientists, and land planning and development specialists to devise and recommend strategies for land use and physical facilities for residential, commercial, industrial, and community uses. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Planning, Architecture, Public Administration or a closely related field of study required. Candidates must have the ability to effectively communicate in the English language, both in verbal and written form and should be able to convey complex information in a clear, concise, and positive manner as well as prepare visual aids and make public presentations in a competent and professional manner. Candidates must also demonstrate the ability to: analyze facts involved in the land-use decision-making process; conduct technical research; interpret and apply department policies and procedures; organize, prioritize, and independently perform work assignments; and manage numerous projects with constant deadlines in a demanding office environment. Applicants must be able to understand and interpret federal, state and local land use laws and processes, as well as Comprehensive Plans, Development Codes, Ordinances. Additionally applicants must have the ability to read and interpret planning maps, subdivision plats, legal descriptions, site plans and architectural drawings. Experience with Microsoft Office Professional and ESRI ArcGIS is required. AutoCAD, InDesign, and Photoshop experience is also desired. Previous related experience of 1-2 years is preferred Master’s degree in planning, architecture, public administration or related field of study is preferred and may be substituted for part of the required experience. At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs. Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Jacobs does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of: race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by country, regional, or local law. To view the DOL's Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster, please click here . Primary Location : United States-Georgia-Atlanta Job Posting : Apr 11, 2016, 2:47:50 PM About Jacobs At approximately $13 Billion in revenues, Jacobs is one of the world's largest and most diverse providers of technical, professional, and construction services, 
				including all aspects of architecture, engineering and construction, operations and maintenance, as well as scientific and specialty consulting. We serve a broad 
				range of companies and organizations, including industrial, commercial, and government clients across multiple markets and geographies. Our global network includes 
				approximately 66,000 employees in more than 250 offices in more than 30 countries, with operations in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, India, 
				Australia, Africa, and Asia. Learn more about Jacobs here. Contact us Privacy & terms ©   Jacobs. All rights reserved. 2014

Available Opportunities in Atlanta, Ga.: Marketing Specialist Director of Business Development Assistant Product Manager Client Solutions Consultant Java Developer Office Assistant Enterprise Sales Manager – Financial Services/Insurance Data Analyst Fraud Analyst Technical Writer Software Development Manager Marketing Specialist IDology is seeking a Marketing Specialist to manage marketing activities supporting multiple solutions across multiple vertical markets including financial services, healthcare, insurance and government. Primary responsibilities will be the creation, execution and optimization of lead generation marketing campaigns and demand generation activities that integrate multiple channels including email, web, search, webinars events and more. This desired candidate will work closely with functional team members in public relations and events to build and drive campaigns. This position reports to the Director of Marketing and will collaborate with all divisions including sales and product management to deliver campaigns that meet marketing and revenue goals. The ideal (or successful) candidate will have experience creating demand generation campaigns for a B2B organization, be able to collaborate with a team, and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to be hands on with various marketing automation and sales enablement tools is important and demonstrated experience with them is required. Additionally, the desired candidate will be able to understand market segmentation and create programs to deliver IDology’s value proposition to multiple audiences. RESPONSIBILITIES Research, develop and support lead list generation initiatives that support sales and marketing objectives Create clear, compelling content that demonstrates deep knowledge and understanding of the business’s solutions and markets and is consistent with the company positioning and brand identity Coordinate digital and search marketing programs Execute lead generation and nurturing activities to support sales goals. Implement demand generation and visibility programs including: email campaigns, PR, PPC and organic search campaigns, traditional marketing campaigns and more to produce high quality leads Measure, track, analyze, and regularly report on the effectiveness of overall demand generation; create projections and measure ROI. Work closely with sales and other internal parties as needed to ensure strategic alignment. Assist in overall marketing planning and evaluate ongoing opportunities to create a sound, cost-effective strategy. BASIC REQUIREMENTS BA in Communications, Journalism, Marketing or related disciplines 2+ years B2B marketing experience with focus in technology B2B marketing preferred 2+ years of digital marketing experience with the understanding of both traditional and digital marketing programs 2+ years of campaign delivery experience with the ability to provide an example of responsibility for campaign execution from start to completion, including budgeting. 2+ years experience with lead nurturing processes, email marketing and marketing automation solutions such as eTrigue or similar applications 2+ years reporting and CRM experience, preferably with Salesforce Working knowledge of paid and organic search with the ability to communicate effectively with external SEO partner Possess strong research and investigative skills with the ability to balance between creative and analytical thinking Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset Positive and enthusiastic with good interpersonal skills and the ability to work well independently or in a team environment Highly motivated, organized, detail-oriented and autonomous self-starter who takes initiative and has the ability to thrive and problem solve under tight deadlines Committed to excellence and high standards Back to the Top Director of Business Development We are seeking a Director of Business Development who will be responsible for generating new sources of revenue by creating and supporting relationships with new partners. This is an exciting role which will have a major contributory impact to the revenue growth of the company. The role will work closely with the VP of Business Development. RESPONSIBILITIES Generate new sources of revenue via business development activities in the assigned markets which can include software, consulting firm, and systems integrators Hunt and develop new opportunities and channels of revenue via OEMs, resellers, and other strategic partner relationships Develop a comprehensive and aligned business development plan Identity, develop, recommend, and implement sales strategies for new target accounts and markets Demonstrate IDology’s software solution in detail, define applications, and articulate key benefits for targeted account applications REQUIREMENTS Proven success selling and building strategic partnerships and channel relationships in the software industry Must have demonstrated entrepreneurial success in working in fast paced environments and with high growth organizations Must be a self-starter, fast learner, and possess the business acumen to articulate benefits of IDology’s identity verification and fraud prevention services for potential partner applications Ability to independently and aggressively identify new prospect opportunities in the assigned targeted markets and accounts, and drive them to closure Consultative selling and training and experience Experience in selling fraud prevention, risk, compliance, security software solutions and tools is a plus Business, MBA, or engineering degree a plus Travel required Position based in Atlanta Back to the Top Assistant Product Manager We are seeking a talented, hardworking, entrepreneurial employee with 1 – 3+ years of experience in software marketing and/or product management to fill our Assistant Product Manager position. The Assistant Product Manager will work with the VP of Products and other Assistant Product Managers to increase the profitability of existing products and develop new products for the company. The Assistant Product Manager will help build products from existing ideas and help to develop new ideas based on industry experience and interaction with customers and prospects. The Assistant Product Manager must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. He/she will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. Additionally, he/she will work with marketing communications to define the go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. Responsibilities: Assist in managing the product line lifecycle from strategic planning to tactical activities Write Product Specifications Understand regulations that impact the product solution both domestic and international Specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers Requirements: 1 to 3+ years of software marketing/product management experience Core competences: computer products knowledge, logistical knowledge of promotional efforts, market development skills, and MS Office Knowledge of technology industry is required Must be a self-starter and proactive Commitment to excellence and high standards Excellent written and verbal communication skills Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions Creative, flexible, and innovative team player Demonstrated ability to make successful presentations to individuals and/or groups at all levels of an organization Strong organizational skills; able to manage priorities and workflow This position requires travel to customer and non-customer sites in North America and Europe Back to the Top Client Solutions Consultant The Client Solutions Consultant will be on the front-line of communications with customers, advising solutions to their application needs. This is a consultative role with the Ideal candidate being personable, intuitive and analytical with an outgoing personality and the ability to build a strong rapport with customers while providing user training and solutions for client support requirements. RESPONSIBILITIES Assume pre and post sales activities by managing relationships directly with customers installing or integrating our services Configuring client business objectives to meet technical requirements Manage technical integration interaction and provide ongoing support Troubleshooting systems and performance issues over the phone and Internet. Analyze software performance and client usage Contribute to customer use of software documentation and training materials Train and support customers Provide 24X7 on call support, as needed BASIC REQUIREMENTS Recent Graduate with Bachelor’s Degree, 3.0 GPA or higher with the desire to grow career in Client Solutions OR Military Experience with the desire to grow career in Client Solutions OR 3+ years Account Management AND/OR IT Support experience. Proficient in Microsoft Windows and Office, specifically Excel Highly motivated, independent worker with an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong comfort level in embarking on unfamiliar tasks. Must have professional phone skills, a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Strong analytical, oral and written communication skills. Strong Multi-tasking and Organizational skills Ability to be on call for 1 week each month. Good working knowledge of the Internet and networks Travel – under 10% DESIRED Previous experience in a help desk or technical support environment Previous experience working in a Technology company Previous working experience with Tableau Software Implementation/Installation experience Back to the Top Java Developer SUMMARY Developer will be a member of a small team focused on developing and deploying commercial Web services.  Projects will involve enhancing existing products and developing new products built on the Java/JEE platform.  Our applications are developed using Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, and Spring. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate with Product Management team to create innovative identity verification and fraud detection services. Interface with Quality Assurance team to ensure bug-free deliverables. Provide input on estimates and progress to Project Manager to ensure timely delivery. Develop and maintain efficient, high-quality web applications using your preferred IDE and following our SDLC process. Follow secure software development practices, paying particular attention to the OWASP Top 10. Create and maintain unit/integration test cases using our in-house automated testing tool. BASIC REQUIREMENTS 5+ years of software development experience 2+ years’ experience with Java 2+ years’ experience with XML 2+ years’ experience with SQL Excellent written communication skills DESIRED Bachelor’s degree, in a technical discipline or related field 10+ years of software development experience Experience writing and deploying Web services Ability to write build scripts with Ant Experience working with an MVC framework like Spring (preferred), Struts, or Webwork. Experience working with PHP Back to the Top Office Assistant SUMMARY As IDology’s Office Assistant, you will perform a variety of tasks and ensure that employees and visitors enjoy a great work environment. This is a part-time position. RESPONSIBILITIES Daily office operations, including ordering supplies, inventory management and managing mail/deliveries Coordinate the on-boarding process for new employees, ensuring a smooth transition and warm welcome to the IDology family Greet visitors and ensure that security protocols are follow Manage various tasks/projects as assigned Answer the phone Filing Maintain office equipment and facilities and coordinate any repair issues Head the social committee and plan and execute company events BASIC REQUIREMENTS Excellent written and verbal communication skills Computer savvy and open to learning new applications Competency with business software such as: Microsoft Office Professional Suite, Adobe Acrobat, etc. Good attention to detail Great team player Customer service driven with the ability to develop relationships with both internal and external personnel A desire to show initiative Work proactively and independently Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet and professional manner Positive, professional, up-beat personality Demonstrated stable employment background and references At least 3 years of work experience in an office setting in an administrative capacity DESIRED College Degree Back to the Top Enterprise Sales Manager – Financial Services/Insurance IDology, a leader in multi-layered identity verification and fraud prevention solutions and named one of this year’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work for® in Atlanta, is looking for a high energy intelligent sales executive to fill a hunter role within our high growth organization. The Enterprise Sales Manager will identify, build and grow strategic relationships with key decision makers with large FIs and Insurance organizations. Expectations for this position include understanding and navigating the sales process in large complex organizations, building and growing a strong pipeline, deep knowledge of IDology’s identity and fraud solutions, closing enterprise level deals and expanding business within these accounts. Responsibilities: Build and develop multi-million dollar pipeline of enterprise level accounts Develop relationships within those accounts and grow the business Forecast new business at a high level of accuracy Learn and develop a deep understanding of IDology solutions Use Salesforce.com to manage the sales process Attend all company sponsored training sessions and apply learned techniques and new products to sales opportunities Continually stay abreast of new product offers, emerging technologies and market drivers. Travel nationally to present and develop relationships Requirements: Position is based in Atlanta, GA Bachelor’s degree and 7-10 years successful sales experience Successful experience selling Fintech SaaS solutions within the financial and insurance verticals Strong computer and web proficiency including experience with Word, Excel and Salesforce.com or other web based sales automation tools Excellent oral and written communication skills Experience with technology and solution based sales Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently as well as in a fast paced team environment Experience in fraud and identity a plus Highly Motivated drive for success Excellent inter-personal and inter-departmental skills Back to the Top Data Analyst The Data Analyst will play an instrumental role in building and providing integrated analysis and ad-hoc reports for our business. Responsibilities: Execute ad-hoc queries to rapidly extract information and generate reports Validate report results to ensure they are accurate and complete Automate ad-hoc queries to schedule on-going reports Apply problem-solving skills to analyze data to result in actionable business improvement recommendations, organize analytic findings into clear, concise written and verbal communications Conduct advanced data analysis to identify trends using data mining algorithms and alert the management on risk and opportunity Perform root cause and impact analysis to investigate issues and make recommendations for potential solutions Effective prioritization and management of multiple requests, including often and proactive communications of time-lines, status, and escalations of issues Analyze software performance and client usage Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data Analyze and problem solve issues with current customers. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data. Work with Sales team in pre-sales activities to perform correlation studies for prospects. Perform monthly review of top customers. Perform quarterly review of mid-tier customers. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings Create and present quality dashboards Requirements: Bachelor’s in Information Management, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields 5+ years of data analytics experience including data models, data mining, database design and segmentation techniques Proven technical skills in data manipulation and analysis with the ability to present complex information and recommendations in a variety of formats and in an understandable and compelling manner. Proven skill-set to write, optimize, and automate SQL queries in both Oracle and Teradata environments Highly proficient in data analysis tools and report development (e.g. – Excel, Access, Tableau) with a strong preference for Tableau Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Proven ability to ensure that quality and timeliness of measurement deliverables meet client expectations Exceptional attention to detail with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Good interpersonal skills with ability to work well in a team environment Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand with the ongoing sense of curiosity and desire to learn something new. Desired Skills and Expertise: 7+ years of data analytics experience including data models, data mining, database design and segmentation techniques. Ability to write, optimize, and automate Hive queries from an Hadoop environment Experience in working with analyzing app or web usage data Experience with analyzing and validating data using Omniture and Splunk Back to the Top Fraud Analyst The Fraud Analyst will be responsible for review and analysis of accounts to detect fraudulent activity.  The ideal candidate will possess Solid decision-making skills, problem solving skills and sound judgment. Responsibilities: Identifying, analyzing and interpreting fraud-like trends or patterns in data. Report trends and findings to executive team and to the client. Provide expertise to manage, manipulate, and analyze data and report results. Analyze software performance and client usage Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data Analyze and problem-solve issues with current customers. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings Create and present quality dashboards Generate routine and ad hoc reports Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Statistics or related field with 3+ years of analytical experience in data, fraud, or audit. Experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate Experience with Tableau or other analytic software tools Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development. Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand. Strong analytic, oral and written communication skills with the ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner. Must have professional phone skills, a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy Desired Skills and Expertise: 5+ years of analytical experience in data, fraud, or auditing Familiarity with investigative tools, public and private records databases, and fraud investigations. Knowledge of statistics Back to the Top Technical Writer Summary IDology is seeking a technical writer to produce high-quality documentation that contributes to successful client integrations. Primary responsibilities include writing documentation for new initiatives and keeping documentation for existing products current. Position will be creating documentation for computer hardware engineers, software developers and data scientists. Responsibilities Collaborate with the product managers to develop innovative documentation for new and existing products. Study product specifications to determine the technical documentation needs and deliver easy to understand user application and developer guides. Create video tutorials to help end-users navigate system settings and applications. Create and maintain the documentation architecture and style. Create sharable diagrams, wireframes and charts to increase user and development teams understanding of solution. Develop and maintain intranet of supporting documentation for internal IDology teams. Support Sales and Business Development by studying and delivering winning responses to Request for Proposals (RFP) and similar procurement mechanisms. Exceptional ability to communicate technical concepts. Policy creation and documentation of Employee Policy Manual, redefining and reinterpreting into updated layout. Creation of Resource Center Materials including development of Videos and Tutorials. Basic  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field. 5+ years’ experience in writing on technical subject matter, preferably in a similar field. 2+ years’ experience with XML, Java or similar programming language. Experienced in revising documentation for internal teams and policies, RFP Support and technical wireframes external use. Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical details effectively. Good interpersonal skills with ability to work well in a team environment Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand with the ongoing sense of curiosity and desire to learn something new. Committed to excellence and high standards. Back to the Top Software Development Manager SUMMARY We are looking for a Software Development Manager who will bring their people management skills and technical experience to lead our company’s software development efforts. This is a key leadership role and responsible for delivery our most strategic technical projects, designing new software systems, and has primary responsibility for development deliverables and deadlines.  Projects will involve enhancing existing products and developing new products built on the Java/JEE platform. Our applications are developed using Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, and Spring. post_text: Software Engineer - CTISL 1075 - Georgia Tech Research Institute Software Engineer - CTISL 1075 Job Number: 1075 Job Classification: Research Faculty Areas of Expertise: CyberSecurity Functional Roles: Software Design/Dev; System Engineering Degree: Bachelor's Level of Experience: Entry Level; Junior Field of Study: Computer Science; Electrical Engineering Rank: Research Engineer I (REI); Research Engineer II  (REII); Research Scientist I  (RSI); Research Scientist II  (RSII) Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: Full Time Close Date: 12/01/2016 Labs/Support Units: Cyber Technology and Information Security Laboratory (CTISL) Description: Title: Software Engineer PVA# Position: Full Time Level: Research Engineer/Scientist I/II Primary Location: Atlanta, GA Travel Required: Minimal Lab: Cyber Technology and Information Security Lab (CTISL) Reporting To: ETCM Division Job Description The Software Developer will perform applied research on sponsored programs targeted at information security and network defense, and participate in internal R&D (IRAD) associated with tool sets designed to probe and defend information repositories and networks.  The Software Developer will also be expected to support conferences, sponsor briefings, participate in delivering content associated with short courses and CTISL’s education initiatives and other activities in support of our outreach activities. Requirements Education: BS in computer science, electrical engineering, or related technical field, MS or PhD preferred. Experience: Candidate must possess 1-2 years professional experience in the information security domain or equivalent classroom / internship experience. Skills: Comprehensive knowledge of emerging threats and information security topics. Candidate must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrated knowledge in automating complex tasks using high-level scripting languages is a must. Candidate must exhibit a strong grasp of programming languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java. Experience in data analytics, distributed data processing, and machine learning is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. Current, industry-recognized certifications (CISSP, GIAC) or the ability to become certified within one year of hire is critical. Certified Information Security System Professional (CISSP) a plus. Other: Candidate must be a US citizen capable of holding a Top Secret DoD Security clearance, active clearance a major plus.

Working professionally in conjunction with the sales team as a key technical advisor and product advocate, the Applications/Product Development Engineer/Scientist (Medical Products) must be able to identify and provide reliable solutions for all technical issues to assure successful product development and overall customer satisfaction through all stages of a product’s life cycle. Ability to conduct routine lab tests, analyze and interpret data, design and develop lab-scale prototypes and provide excellent documentation. Manage the transfer of new products and technologies from laboratory prototypes to production scale. Collaborate and work well with others on teams both cross-functionally and globally. Skills/Qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to communicate and influence at all levels within the organization. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment on multiple projects while interfacing with more than one customer. Demonstrate the ability to lead, develop and challenge a diverse team to achieve/exceed performance expectations. Solid project management capabilities and the ability to organize and manage projects simultaneously from origin through execution. Demonstrate flexibility with business deadlines and the ability to readily adapt to changing environments. Positive attitude and ability to follow directions while demonstrating high levels of collaboration and performance on teams. Experience designing medical tapes, skin contact adhesives or devices for Medical Industry. Knowledge of ISO 10993 with an in-depth understanding of material biocompatibility and test methods. Familiarity with FDA regulatory requirements and GMP/standard compliance for Medical Products. Travel: Expected travel is 10-15% of the time. Lead Information Architect - DITA We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. RESPONSIBILITIES: Analyze department roles, processes, and other related requirements to facilitate optimal configuration of the CCMS environment to ensure efficient authoring, editing, reviewing, and publishing workflows Develop metadata and reuse strategies (including, but not limited to, the use of DITA specializations, keyrefs, conrefs, conkeyrefs, and linking) that will facilitate the development and delivery of content that must be single-sourced across multiple products, product platforms (vhcm, wfn, etc.), delivery platforms (revui, vdl, etc.) business units, sub-business unit types, devices, audiences, sub-audience types, releases, and varying user permissions in delivery types that include, but are not limited to, HTML, WebHelp, PDF, and XLIFF, as well as XML that must be able to be consumed by multiple internal (ex: search management) and external (ex: translation management and dynamic publishing) systems Develop metadata/taxonomy solution that supports both complex conditional publishing and search optimization requirements Analyze documentation requirements, including metadata, reuse, linking and other strategies, to determine CCMS configuration specifications Develop and execute CCMS configuration and user acceptance test plans Troubleshoot CCMS implementation and configuration issues and coordinate resolutions across internal development and external vendor support teams Support content conversion, including developing guidelines for pre-conversion content modification, analyzing content to determine conversion rules, developing guidelines for post-conversion edits, and developing/executing conversion test plans Develop strategy to enable the creation of user-specific translation packages (i.e., exclude content for certain roles, where applicable, from translation packages) and to facilitate the exclusion of certain content from translation into specific languages (as opposed to excluding it from translation entirely) Test post-localized content to ensure that valid DITA and structural markup have been preserved during the translation process Develop DITA transforms for multiple delivery types (PDF, HTML, WebHelp, etc.) that address complex formatting, linking, and conditional publishing scenarios Create automated build processes using ANT to deliver content across multiple environments Develop ADP-specific DITA and CCMS user guides Provide training in writing properly structured, information-typed, localization-friendly, valid DITA content that has appropriate metadata and markup applied Perform structural and semantic reviews and editing QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Experience using minimalist writing and structured authoring principles to maximize searchability, conditional profiling, and content reusability in a highly complex, single-sourced project environment Experience designing and writing content using DITA in a content management environment Experience publishing from DITA source to multiple channels (PDF, HTML, WebHelp, Mobile, etc.) Knowledge of DITA 1.2, DITA-OT, HTML5, DTDs, ditavals, XML, XSLT, XSL-FO, HTML, CSS, and ANT (knowledge of DITA 1.3 preferred) Knowledge of scripting languages required (API development a plus) Expertise in implementing DITA-based authoring tools and component content management systems (experience with Oxygen XML and IXIASOFT DITACMS preferred) Ability to explain rationale behind, and distill information regarding, complex technical solutions to an audience of diverse stakeholders with potentially divergent or competing requirements Experience in optimizing technical content for translation/localization and in integrating CMS and TMS solutions (experience with SDL WorldServer preferred) Experience in scaling large technical documentation projects for multiple languages, output formats, and device types Experience in converting legacy content to DITA (experience with Stilo Migrate and/or in developing custom conversion solutions preferred) Experience in developing instructional/reference materials and facilitating training for writers who are DITA and/or CCMS novices LITECH PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Software in the Cloud. post_text: Job Details Skip Navigation Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account Sr. Data Analyst - Supply Chain (94914) GA - Atlanta Share: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Apply with LinkedIn Position Description Position Purpose : A Sr Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages proven technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively among other talented analysts to apply established and create new analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeks out opportunities to learn new and hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and operates under minimal supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists. • Analyzes key transportation and supply chain dynamics to achieve operational objectives, superior customer service-levels, and optimal costs • Leverages database management skills and critical thinking to develop ad hoc reporting and conduct analysis on supply chain synchronization and optimization projects • Develops and manages key relationships with transportation service providers and cross-functional partners to operate and optimize The Home Depot’s transportation network, supply chain, and end-to-end business Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities: 30%-Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests 20%-Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities 20%-Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail 20%-Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture 10%-Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group Nature and Scope: This position reports to Manager or Sr Manager This position has no Direct Reports Environmental Job Requirements: Environment:  Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel:  Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. ESSENTIAL SKILLS Standard Minimum Qualifications : Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must pass the Drug Test. Must pass Background Check. Must pass pre-employment test if applicable. Additional Minimum Qualifications : Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. Work Experience Required: 2 Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Additional Qualifications : B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance, or related quantitative field. Work experience with MS Excel, MS Access, SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems. Preferred Qualifications: 2-4 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting. An intermediary understanding of SQL or working directly with MS Access joining relational tables together and/or some knowledge of one other scripting/compiled/statistical programming language (e.g. VBA, Python, R, SAS, .NET, C++, Java, etc.) Experience building reports/analyses with analytical tools (e.g. Excel, JMP, SAS, Mathematica, SPSS, Tableau, etc.) Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.) Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies : Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving. An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data. Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way. Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment. Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques. title: Data Visualization Software Engineer
summary: You will work closely with data scientists, product managers and other engineers to create and translate concept into concrete products....
post_text:
Job Board Powered by Bullhorn Apr 17, 2016 Jobs Your Profile Login Job #11728: Data Job Code: #11728 Title: Data Visualization Software Engineer Date Posted: 04/07/2016 Job Type: Contract To Hire Job Location: Atlanta
             
                
            
                GA Job Description: Data Visualization Software Engineer Contract to hire opportunity for a strong front end developer/designer with good analytic skills to help build out and enhance a crucial application for this global company. In this role, you will work directly with client and internal team members to develop and support interactive data visualizations used across the enterprise, and conduct data analysis with outcomes that include delivery of actionable insights and business intelligence. You will build real-time interactive visualizations and APIs in JavaScript, HTML5 to make data easy to understand and access across the organization. You will be responsible for developing data visualization based on streaming and stored data points. You will work closely with data scientists, product managers and other engineers to create and translate concept into concrete products. You will be designing the visualization for streaming data, as API calls are hitting environments and lot of other data sets, including things like location data and profile data. This data will be used to show large data sets, that when then possibly used to display graphs, charts etc. The ideal candidate must have extensive experience programming on front end with JavaScript and HTML 5 and then experience with pulling in the data figuring out how to display as the users need it. You must be a technical person that understands the visual and creative side as well. This information will be in the face of the end-user, so the ideal candidate really needs to have done data visualization as well.  You must know how to display data and be able to collect data from different data sources. SQL Query ability is a must. This is a high level development position and this group is run like a West Coast development shop....so expect a lot of collaboration and knowledge sharing, white boarding and analyzing code. And the chance to build something new and cutting edge that doesn't exist on this scale anywhere else! REQUIRED SKILLS: Advanced programming skills in JavaScript, HTML5 5 years of broad experience in Data Analysis and Business Intelligence Hands-on development experience in frontend / data visualization Experience in visualizing data to illustrate business-analytic intents SQL query skills PLID: 2052

title: Geologist or Environmental Scientist - Mid Level
summary: Records data prepares reports, provides analysis and interpretations of findings based on scientific experimentation and existing knowledge....
post_text: Geologist or Environmental Scientist - Mid Level #390638 Georgia - Atlanta Geologist or Environmental Scientist - Mid Level Georgia - Atlanta Apply View All Jobs Share This Job Job Description GES' Atlanta area Roswell, GA office seeks a mid level Environmental Scientist or Geologist to join their team. Must possess drilling oversight experience and the ability to lead subsurface events. Responsibilities and Duties: Handles case management/project management, including managing the implementation of project work plans including staff briefing, scheduling, budgeting, subcontractor coordination and client / regulatory interaction. Performs groundwater sampling, gauging and product bailing, and surveying. Participates in monitoring well installations and sampling events. Compiles and completes field notes on each event/site. Researches information relating to identifying geological formations and soil delineation studies and prepares reports and geological maps based on the findings. Records data prepares reports, provides analysis and interpretations of findings based on scientific experimentation and existing knowledge. Evaluates, analyzes and interprets technical data relative to project-specific goals, creates and interprets accurate data display graphs and figures, completes basic fate and transport analysis, and identifies data gaps and data needs leading to development of a Conceptual Site Model. Performs hydrogeological assessments regarding groundwater flows to identify contamination impact and related concerns. Participates in the identification of viable remedial solutions consistent with all Federal, state, and local regulations. Prepares technically accurate, complete and concise work plans based on evaluation of site data needs. Ensures adherence to client and corporate contract specifications in all activities including Health, Safety, Security, and Environment. Skills & Requirements A Bachelor's degree or higher in Geology, Environmental Science, Engineering or a related disciple 3-6+ years of related experience. Must have hands on field & office experience in the environmental consulting field. Must possess drilling oversight experience and the ability to lead subsurface events. Familiarity with Underground Storage Tank regulations and RCRA / CERLA is highly preferred. Must possess excellent communication and technical writing skills and be able to independently prepare a complete deliverable report with a focus on QA/QC. Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, Adobe, geologic logging/cross section. programs required.  Experience with database/graphics management (Access, GIS, CAD) a plus Must be detail-oriented, and a team player with good communication, analytical, organization, and time management skills. Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world's largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. We were first in our industry to offer a SaaS solution and continue to push the envelope utilizing the latest operating platforms to deliver the highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions that are redefining what is possible. Named one of Forbes' "Most Innovative Companies" and one of Computerworld's "100 Best Places to Work in IT", we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. Join us as we undertake one of ADP's most ambitious transformation initiatives ever. We're building a team from of the most elite, game-changing technologists and asking them to reinvent payroll for tens of millions of employees worldwide. If you are a sharp, self-driven product manager who is passionate about solving really big problems, we want to talk to you. We are looking for a hands-on Product Manager with experience and expertise in the following; payroll software compliance, user-centered design and program management at scale. This key role will serve as a hands-on product owner in a Scrum environment, developing ADP's global statutory compliance capabilities. Later, this person will develop additional tools and technologies to federate statutory maintenance across the globe. This person needs to be a visionary, UX-focused product manager with strong attention to detail and a track record of pushing solutions from concept through production. This position involves close interaction with development leads, product architects, and key customers. A strong technical background is required. Responsibilities Develop the framework and toolset that localization teams will use to configure statutory payroll requirements across geographies. Conduct technology assessments of potential partners for complementary statutory services and provide recommendations for build/buy/partner. Partner with statutory analysts across multiple teams to develop highly intuitive tools to maintain statutory requirements. Partner with development and design teams throughout ADP's business units to drive a consistent application of payroll capabilities to all users. Maintain close working relationship with launch management and support teams across ADP business units. Maintain a prioritized, vetted backlog of features for the payroll practitioner. Work with Product Marketing to build awareness and understanding through blogs, external presentations, volunteer groups, etc... Requirements Must have recent, relevant experience in all of the following; payroll software compliance, user-centered design and program management at scale Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization Excellent written and verbal communication skills. MS/BS degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent preferred. LITECH ADPTECH Software in the Cloud. are endless. Civilian careers-where purpose and patriotism unite! The selectee for

knowledge, skills, and abilities, to perform the duties of the specific
position for which you are being considered.   Your resume is the key

Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: Attention to
Detail: Takes a thorough, conscientious approach to work performed; Customer
Service: Identifies a client or customer need and provides a quality product or
service. Oral Communication: Expresses information via oral presentation; AND
Problem Solving: Identifies problem, ascertains root cause and impact, and
provides recommendations for resolution. Specialized experience for this
position involves providing technical expertise in application of information
technology (IT) systems analysis methods; a broad knowledge of the designs and
operations of software development; AND practical knowledge of logistics
functions and business processes. ( Note -
experience must be substantiated in your resume). Additional qualification information can be found
from the following Office of Personnel Management web site: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/2200/information-technology-it-management-series-2210-alternative-a/ You will receive credit for all
qualifying experience, including volunteer and part time experience. You must
clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the
total number of hours per week. Experience
refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through
National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious,
spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical
competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and
experience that translates directly to paid employment. As part of the
application process, you must complete and submit an occupational
questionnaire. To preview this questionnaire and determine if your experience
matches the required skills for this position, click the following link: View Assessment Questions Please follow
all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating and/or
appointment eligibility. REQUIREMENTS: A secret security clearance is a requirement of this position.
Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in
the withdrawal of a position offer or removal.   If you possess a security
clearance, please indicate the level and termination date in your resume. Incumbent must obtain and maintain Oracle Certified Associate
(OCA) or higher certification. Incumbent
must be able and willing to travel 1-5 days per month away from my duty
location. Incumbent
must be able and willing to accept a mission essential position which requires
me to report and or remain at work regardless of inclement weather, national
disasters/emergencies. Incumbent
must be able and willing to perform temporary duty at locations other than my
permanent duty station which may include travel by military or commercial
flights. Incumbent
must be able and willing to work an uncommon tour of duty (includes weekend,
nights, or holidays) as required. Incumbent
may be recalled to duty. Work
is sedentary, although there may be some carrying of books, printouts, manuals,
files and equipment. Work
is performed in a typical office setting. Security Clearance Not Applicable Additional Information Additional Information What To Expect Next When the
application process is complete, your application will be reviewed to determine
if you meet the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in
this announcement. You will be
rated based on the information provided in your resume and responses to the
questionnaire, along with your supporting documentation to determine your level
of knowledge, skill, and ability, related to the job requirements. Best qualified
applicants will be referred to the hiring manager. The selecting official may choose
to conduct interviews, and once the selection is made, you will receive a
notification of the decision. Stay informed of
changes to your application status by signing up for automatic email alerts at: https://www.usajobs.gov/Applicant/Application/ListApplications . BENEFITS Department of the Navy offers a comprehensive
benefits package that includes, in part, paid vacation, sick leave, holidays, a
401K-type retirement plan, and an Employee Assistance Program. More information
can be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Benefits/Pages/Default.aspx Other Information This Position is covered by the Department
of Defense Priority Placement Program. Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement. Recruitment incentives are NOT authorized. Relocation incentives are NOT authorized. A tentative offer of employment will be
rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements,
including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments. The Department of the Navy uses E-Verify to
confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more
about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify . Military Spouse Preference (MSP) : http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/Mil_Spouse_Pref_Statement.pdf Federal annuitant information : The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense
and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf Veteran's Preference Information : http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/Vet_%20Preference_Statement.pdf ICTAP Applicants : To be considered
well-qualified and exercise selection priority as an ICTAP candidate, displaced
Federal employees must satisfy all qualification requirements for the position
and receive a rating of 85 or higher. For
more information about ICTAP eligibility please review the following link: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/ICTAP_Statement.pdf This job originated on www.usajobs.gov . For the full announcement and to apply,
                                        visit www.usajobs.gov/GetJob/ViewDetails/436021100 .
                                        Only resumes submitted according to the instructions on the job announcement listed at www.usajobs.gov will be considered. How to Apply How to Apply To
begin the process, click the Apply
Online button to create an account or log in to your existing USAJOBS
account. Follow the prompts to complete
the occupational questionnaire. Please ensure you click the Submit My Answers button at the end
of the process. To
apply for this position, you must provide a complete Application Package which
includes: - Complete Resume. - Complete Assessment Questionnaire. View Occupational Questionnaire - Other
supporting documentation as required.  Please see the " REQUIRED DOCUMENTS" section to
determine if there are other documents you are required to submit. Your complete
application (resume, assessment questionnaire, and all supporting
documents) must be submitted by 11:59 pm Eastern Standard Time (EST) on Wednesday, April 20, 2016. Please follow all instructions
carefully as missing application information will not be requested. Applications
received after Wednesday, April 20, 2016 may result is an ineligible rating and loss of
consideration. If more than one resume is received, only the last resume
received and processed will be reviewed. If you upload your documents, do not fax the same
documents. Note: To check the status of your application or return to a previous or
incomplete application, log into your USAJOBS account: https://mydon.usajobs.gov/Account/Login select Application
Status, and click on the more information link under the application
status for this position. You'll be directed to the Details page in Application
Manager that will display the status of your application, documentation
received and processed, and any correspondence related to this application.
Your uploaded documents may take several hours to clear the virus scan process
so please plan appropriately. ***You
are encouraged to apply online. Applying online will allow you to review and
track the status of your application.*** If
you are unable to apply online or unable to upload your supporting documents follow
the directions located at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/Application_Info_How_to_Apply_via_Fax.pdf Note : Faxing an application package (eg. 1203-FX) will not
allow you to review and track the status of your application unless you have
completed the application process in USAJOBS. This Vacancy ID is
1665031 . Do not email or send
hard copy resumes/applications to the Contact Information or Agency Information
listed in this vacancy announcement. All
resumes/applications received at the addresses listed in the Contact
Information or Agency Information will be destroyed and will not be considered
for this vacancy announcement. ** It is the
applicant's responsibility to verify that information and
documents entered, uploaded, or faxed is received, legible and
accurate.  HR will not modify answers/documents submitted by an applicant.
** . How You Will Be Evaluated When the
application process is complete, we will review your resume to ensure you meet
the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in this
announcement. You will be rated based on the information provided in your
resume and responses to the Occupational Questionnaire, along with your
supporting documentation to determine your ability to demonstrate the following
competencies: 1. Knowledge of
information technology (it) system and software analysis. 2. Skill in
information technology (it) systems management. 3. Ability to manage
databases. You will be
evaluated and rated under Category Rating selection procedures. Additional
points are not added for veterans' preference; however, preference is still
applied. Applicants eligible for veteran's preference will receive selection
priority over non-veterans. If you meet the
qualification requirements, your application will be placed in one of three
categories: Best Qualified- Candidates in this category possess exceptional skills and experience
to exceed well above the minimum requirements for announced position. Well Qualified- Candidates in this category possess good skills and
experience above the minimum requirements for announced position. Qualified- Candidates in this category meet the minimum experience requirements
for announced position. If, after
reviewing your resume and supporting documentation, a determination is made
that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience, your score may be
adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities or you may be found
ineligible/not qualified. Please follow
all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or
consideration for employment. Required Documents Required Documents The documents
you are required to submit vary based on what you are claiming (i.e., applying
as a veteran or disabled veteran, applying as a military spouse, etc). Please

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Medical Technologist - Full Time Nights - Scottish Rite. (1601481) Job Description Medical Technologist - Full Time Nights - Scottish Rite. Description The Medical technologist provides timely and quality clinical information by accurately performing laboratory tests and procedures.  Works effectively with others to meet the needs of the patients and care providers.  To proactively support the efforts that ensures delivery of safe patient care and services and to promote a safe environment at Children’s. ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Processes orders and specimens, independently performs testing procedures, and reports test results according to standard operating procedures. Correlates results with patient age and/or condition, recognizes deviation from expected results, analyzes and corrects problems using standard operating procedures. Operates instruments using established protocols and quality assurance check; performs preventive and corrective maintenance on instruments. Performs, records and analyzes QC data; makes judgments concerning the results and takes appropriate action, when necessary, to maintain accuracy and precision. Maintains current profession skills and technical competency as defined by Laboratory Competency policy. Follows departmental and system policies and procedures. Supports and participates in the continuous assessment and improvement of the quality of care and services provided. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS A Bachelor of Science degree in Medical Technology or a related science is preferred. Certification as a Medical Technologist or Medical Laboratory Scientist (ASCP or equivalent) or the technologist qualifications according to the Department of Community Health Diagnostics Services Unit. For person recently moved into the state or have recently completed the academic and training/experience requirements may be temporarily classified as technologists or technicians for eighteen (18) months only to afford the persons an opportunity to successfully complete an approved qualifying examination. Previous experience in a clinical laboratory is preferred. Requires a limited use of independent judgment and with minimum technical supervision. Location : Children's at Scottish Rite Hours Per Week : 36 : For Technical help, please refer to the Frequently Asked Questions page . ©2011 Children's Healthcare of Atlanta Inc. All Rights Reserved.

Working at ADP Skip Navigation Select Language ? ? Careers Home About ADP Why ADP It takes smart technology to revolutionize business Innovate with us. Search Our Jobs Search ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone Payroll Technical Analyst Apply Now Job ID 118531 Date posted 04/06/2016 Job # 118531 Job Title Payroll Technical Analyst Job Category Technology Work Location Alpharetta GA (2575 Westside Pkwy - 20015) Employment Status Full-Time Job Description Unlock Your Career Potential: Technology at ADP . Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world's largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. We were first in our industry to offer a SaaS solution and continue to push the envelope utilizing the latest operating platforms to deliver the highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions that are redefining what is possible. Named one of Forbes' "Most Innovative Companies" and one of Computerworld's "100 Best Places to Work in IT", we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees. POSITION SUMMARY We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. Technical Analyst -- Payroll Development Join us as we undertake one of ADP's most ambitious transformation initiatives ever. We're building a team from of the most elite, game-changing technologists and asking them to reinvent payroll for tens of millions of employees worldwide. If you know payroll and love solving tough challenges, we want to talk to you. We're looking for a Technical Analyst that can define payroll business rules using ADP's tools and technologies. Someone with a development background who moved into analysis and who has domain expertise in HCM/payroll is required. Responsibilities Analyze and convert payroll business rules, specifications and requirements into Payroll language Code and test the Payroll Troubleshoot runtime issues and errors and interpret log results Document test cases Requirements Must have experience with HCM & Payroll software and background in development of payroll systems. Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization Excellent written and verbal communication skills. MS/BS degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred. ADPTECH LITECH Software in the Cloud. Experts on the Ground: ADP powers the working world with comprehensive solutions that drive business success. Consistently named one of the "Most Admired Companies" by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by Forbes® as one of "The World's Most Innovative Companies," ADP has over a half-million clients around the globe and 65 years of experience as one of the largest providers of human capital management solutions world-wide. At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation.  ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status.  We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance. ADP Job ID: 118531 Apply Now The ADP Experience If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. It's our associates that count. At ADP our associates enjoy a robust and diverse organization that provides unlimited career building opportunities and professional development programs. Working within supportive teams, our professionals collaborate to achieve common goals and are recognized for their individual achievements. We want you to soar. If you give us your all, in return, we will open doors and support you so you can take your life to new and greater heights both professionally and personally. Our culture is one that invests heavily in the growth and development of our human capital – you. Work with us and enjoy: Competitive Compensation Comprehensive Healthcare Benefits Paid Time Off (vacation, holiday and personal days) Annual Community Service Hours (Paid Time Off) Corporate Discount Portal 401(k) Company Contributions Reimbursement Accounts Survivor Benefits Tuition Reimbursement On-site childcare (in some locations) Associate Recognition Program …and much more! ADP is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants
