title: Communications Specialist
summary: Develop, produce, and disseminate information for a variety of audiences, scientists, health care and other public health professionals and organizations, the...
post_text: Careers | Karna LLC Karna LLC Careers For full functionality of this site it is necessary to enable JavaScript. Communications Specialist Job Tracking ID : 512790-530828 Job Location : Atlanta, GA Job Level : Mid Career (2+ years) Level of Education : Masters Degree Job Type : Full-Time/Regular Date Updated : April 13, 2016 Years of Experience : 7 - 10 Years Starting Date : April 18, 2016 Invite a friend Back to job search Job Description: Karna is recruiting to fill an important opening for a Communications Specialist in support of an existing contract that we have supporting our client the CDC/DGMQ (Centers for Disease Control & Prevention/Division of Global Migration & Quarantine). The qualified candidate will use their past CDC related experience to provide the following support tasks: • Organize and manage a variety of communication activities • Design and produce a variety of guidelines development, training, education and communication materials in support of the DGMQ education, communication, training, and guidelines development missions • Write materials for publication and presentation, to include, but not limited to data visualizations, data sheets and PowerPoint presentations • Develop, produce, and disseminate information for a variety of audiences, scientists, health care and other public health professionals and organizations, the public, partners, other CDC staff, and other government agencies • Coordinate information-gathering from DGMQ branches and units to inform development of communication, education, and training materials • Provide oversight/assist in the design and production of distance based learning activities • Develop training curriculum, content, and supporting materials to meet learning objectives • Provide guidance and advice on the implementation of public health education programs, projects and activities related to guidelines development, training, communication and education • Organize and coordinate evaluation workgroup sessions to help improve evaluation capacity within DGMQ • Evaluate websites and materials and use results for improving future web and material development • Develop evaluation protocols and plans • Manage, coordinate, and triage DGMQ’s public inquiry requests to subject matter experts • Liaise with agency representatives for CDC-Info to ensure accurate protocols • Ensure division subject matter experts respond in a timely way • Write evaluation reports and present on findings • Update and revise DGMQ website based on evaluation results • Provide support to management of the DGMQ website as needed by serving as back-up liaison to the Center web team, coordinating meetings with branch and unit staff developing web content developing guidance for web processes and clearance, and working with reviewers to ensure content has been cleared • Use expert knowledge of health education/health promotion methodologies, when guiding the development of health communication/education/evaluation strategies • Coordinate field-based qualitative training and data collection activities • Conduct monitoring and evaluation activities with domestic and international partners • Assist with questions and issues related to health education and communication Experience and Skills Master's Degree required 7-10 years of relative CDC experience required Founded in 2008 and headquartered in Atlanta, Karna is an SBA certified 8(a), economically disadvantaged woman-owned small business dedicated to: 'Improving health through transformational strategies, evidence-based approaches, and effective technologies'. We are focused on providing programmatic and information technology (IT) consulting services for various government agencies and private organizations. post_text: W.K. Dickson & Co., Inc. W.K. Dickson & Co., Inc. Civil Project Engineer - Site Development Atlanta, GA   30339 Company Overview: WK Dickson believes that our people are our most valuable asset. From engineers to urban planners and scientists to surveyors, WK Dickson offers its clients a vast network of talent and passion. WK Dickson’s people are the best in the business, and our success comes from the personal drive of each of us. Our firm was built on the philosophy that people do business with people they like. That goes for our coworkers, too. We work hard. We take risks. We succeed together. Job Responsibilities Project Engineers are responsible for a variety of activities including, and not limited to, performing standard and complex design tasks, requiring the operation and application of computer aided design equipment such as a plotter, and associated peripheral equipment, performing standard, complex, and non-routine design tasks, requiring extensive skill and knowledge of CAD applications, supporting project managers in regards to utilizing CAD, mathematical analysis / calculations, and general project organization. Analyze and organize project data with accuracy, neatness, and timeliness. Utilize appropriate software applications. Work from sketches, notes and other input material to produce computer generated graphs, charts, overlays and completed drawings. Complete finished product with limited direction. Understand and follow company standard CAD procedures for layering, etc., and standard drawing procedures for sheet layout. Suggest improvements to standard procedures. Search, investigate, and select technical reference data pertinent to a project. Prepare and assist with developing project computations, estimates, surveys, statistics, and designs. Prepare and calculate off-site data, such as; traffic volumes, and storm water runoffs. Deliver projects to clients. Maintain technical coordination with staff. Maintain positive communication with staff, clients and subcontractors. Follow general instructions and company policies and procedures. Comply with all company safety policies and rules. Perform additional duties as assigned. Job Requirements Bachelors Degree in practice area from accredited university. Professional license (PE) Minimum five (5) years of civil engineering experience in Site Development, Aviation experience preferred Analytical skills with ability to prepare statistical reports. Ability to work well independently and on a team. Ability to communicate ideas and technical information to staff, supervisors and clients in a professional manner. Travel as necessary to meet the needs of the position. Company Benefits: Employees are able to take advantage of our: Exclusive ‘Talent Development Program’ Project Management Curriculum Leadership Retreats Mentoring Program In addition WK Dickson offers its employees a competitive benefits package including: Competitive salaries Medical, dental, prescription drug, and vision care plans Matching 401K program Life insurance Short and long term disabilities benefits Supplemental insurance option Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy Paid Holidays Continuing education / tuition reimbursement Professional registration reimbursement Flexible spending account (FSA) Performance-based incentives Spot bonuses Employee referral bonuses Flex-time policy (half-day Fridays) Moving and relocation assistance Business casual work environment Company-sponsored social events Community giving and charitable programs Specific programs vary by region, in accordance with the competitive environments of local areas. Accessibility: If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process please contact us at 704-334-5348 Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans. title: DON PATHWAYS RECENT GRADUATE PROGRAM (GENERAL ENGINEER)
summary: From pipefitters to accountants, scientists to engineers, doctors to nurses-the careers and opportunities to make a difference are endless....
post_text:
USAJobs - Job Announcement Skip to main content Skip to footer site map Toggle Menu Home Search Jobs Basic Search Advanced Search Map Search (BETA) My Account My Account - Main Page Profile Resumes Saved Searches Inbox Saved Jobs Saved Documents Application Status Resource Center Resource Center - Main Page Supplemental Forms Individuals with Disabilities Veterans Students and Recent Graduates Senior Executives Spotlights FAQs Support Sign In | Create an Account Refine Your Search Keyword: Keyword: Job Title, Skills, Agency (etc) Keyword Tips Location: Location: City, State, ZIP Code, or Country Search Advanced Search Back to Search results DON PATHWAYS RECENT GRADUATE PROGRAM (GENERAL ENGINEER) U.S. Atlantic Fleet, Commander in Chief Agency contact information Few vacancies in the following location: Kings Bay, GA Work Schedule is Full Time - Recent Graduates Opened Friday 4/8/2016 (9 day(s) ago) Closes Friday 7/8/2016 (82 day(s) away) Salary Range $36,470.00 to $56,015.00 / Per Year Series & Grade GS-0801-05/07 Promotion Potential 12 Supervisory Status No Who May Apply This announcement is open to recent graduates who have successfully completed, within the previous two years, a qualifying associates, bachelors, masters, professional, doctorate, vocational or technical degree or certificate from a qualifying educational institution. NOTE: You must also meet the educational requirements of the position to be filled. Control Number 435241800 Job Announcement Number EA60801-12-1674302LZ336840P Apply Print Share Save Job Overview Job Overview Summary The Navy and Marine Corps team offers innovative, exciting and meaningful work linking military and civilian talents to achieve our mission and safeguard our freedoms. Department of the Navy provides competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and extensive professional development and training. From pipefitters to accountants, scientists to engineers, doctors to nurses-the careers and opportunities to make a difference are endless. Civilian careers-where purpose and patriotism unite! This position is
located in the Waterfront Engineering Services Branch (TRF Code 411),
Engineering Services Division (TRF Code 410), Planning Department (TRF Code
400), TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRIREFFAC) Kings Bay, GA. This is a one
year program. After completion of this program there is potential for
conversion to the competitive service, this is a developmental position and has
full promotion potential to the GS-12. The Recent
Graduates Program affords developmental experiences in the Federal Government
intended to promote possible careers in the civil service to individuals who
have recently graduated from qualifying educational institutions or programs. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT HAS AN INITIAL CUT-OFF DATE OF
APRIL 20, 2016.  FIRST CONSIDERATION WILL BE GIVEN TO COMPLETED
APPLICATIONS RECEIVED BY THE INITIAL CUT-OFF DATE. SECOND CUT-OFF DATE OF MAY 28, 2016. Duties · Provides engineering support services in a specific
technical discipline related to the maintenance and overhaul of nuclear
submarines. · Shadows senior level engineers and engineering
technicians to gain a better understanding of submarine maintenance work. · Obtains training and development in technical
documents, instructions, and other manuals associated with submarine
maintenance. · Interfaces with subject matter experts, mechanics,
and other technical personnel in support of the shipyard mission. Recent
Graduates Eligibility: Recent graduates who have completed, within the
previous two years, a qualifying associates, bachelors, masters, professional,
doctorate, vocation or technical degree or certificate from a qualifying
educational institute. NOTE: Applications will be accepted from students
who expect to complete qualifying education up to 9 months prior to the closing
date of this job opportunity announcement. However, agencies are required to
verify that the education has been completed successfully before any applicant
can be appointed (report to work); therefore, your selection or start date may
be impacted by proof and completion of all Pathways requirements. Recent
Graduates Eligibility for some Veterans: Veterans unable to apply within two years of
receiving their degree, due to military service obligation, have two years from
the date of military separation to apply - not to exceed six years from
the date of completion of the degree. Travel Required Occasional Travel Travel is dependent upon position description and availability of funding. Relocation Authorized No Job Requirements Job Requirements Key Requirements Selectee is required to sign a participant agreement. Males must be registered or exempt from Selective Service. www.sss.gov Selectee must be determined suitable for federal employment. Selectee may be required to successfully complete a probationary period. Selectee is required to participate in the direct deposit pay program. See special requirements section for additional requirements. Qualifications In order to
qualify for this position, your resume must provide sufficient experience
and/or education, knowledge, skills, and abilities, to perform the duties of
the specific position for which you are being considered. Your resume is the
key means we have for evaluating your skills, knowledge, and abilities, as they
relate to this position. Therefore, we encourage you to be clear and specific
when describing your experience. Applicants must
meet the following positive education qualifications requirements of the Office
of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: BASIC REQUIREMENTS: All applicants must meet the following basic requirements which are
fully qualifying for the GS-05 level. Applicants who wish to qualify for positions at higher grade levels must
meet additional requirements under general and/or specialized experience. A. Degree : Degree in
professional engineering. To be acceptable, the curriculum must: (1) be in a
school of engineering with at least one curriculum accredited by the
Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) as a professional
engineering curriculum; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and
courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the
following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics;
(b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics,
hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature
and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to
properties); and (g) any other comparable area of
fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil
mechanics, or electronics. OR B. Combination of
education and experience -- college-level education, training, and/or
technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical
and mathematical sciences underlying professional engineering, and (2) a good
understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and
techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The
adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following: 1. Professional registration -- Current registration as a professional engineer by any State, the District
of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard,
those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written
test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for
positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their
registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a
State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be
rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions. 2. Written Test -- Evidence of
having successfully passed the Engineer-in-Training (EIT) examination, or the
written test required for professional registration, which is administered by
the Boards of Engineering Examiners in the various States, the District of
Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico. Applicants who have
passed the EIT examination and have completed all the requirements for either
(a) a bachelor's degree in engineering technology (BET) from an accredited
college or university that included 60 semester hours of courses in the
physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences, or (b) a BET from a program
accredited by the Accreditation Board for
Engineering and Technology (ABET) may be rated eligible for certain engineering
positions at GS-5. Eligibility is limited to positions that are within or closely
related to the specialty field of the engineering technology program.
Applicants for positions that involve highly technical research, development,
or similar functions requiring an advanced level of competence in basic science
must meet the basic requirements in paragraph A. Because of the diversity
in kind and quality of BET programs, graduates of other BET programs are
required to complete at least 1 year of additional education or highly
technical work experience of such nature as to provide reasonable assurance of
the possession of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required for
professional engineering competence. The adequacy of this background must be
demonstrated by passing the EIT examination. 3. Specified academic courses --
Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical,
mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the
courses specified in the basic requirements. The courses must be fully
acceptable toward meeting the requirements of a professional engineering
curriculum as described in paragraph A. 4. Related curriculum --
Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in
engineering technology or in an appropriate professional field, e.g., physics,
chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology,
may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has
had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under
professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be
either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional
engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type
experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. (The above examples of
related curricula are not all-inclusive.) AND SPECIALIZED
EXPERIENCE FOR GS-07: In order to qualify for this position, your resume must demonstrate at least
one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-05 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent
experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience is defined
as experience that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be
filled and has equipped you with the particular knowledge, skills, and
abilities, to perform successfully the duties of the position such as: Defining HM&E systems/equipment test
     requirements, specifications, drawings, sketches, etc. Providing on-site inspections, evaluates and
     analyzes NDT data, and provides technical engineering reports. Diagnosing substandard performance of
     submarine systems and equipment, and specifies corrective actions. Developing technical documents to be utilized
     in troubleshooting and fault isolation, repair, testing, and recertification. Providing technical input for resolution of
     departure from specifications requests associated with repair and
     maintenance actions. Additional qualification information can be
found from the following Office of Personnel Management web site: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800/ You will receive
credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer and part time
experience. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each
position held and the total number of hours per week. Experience
refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through
National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious,
spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical
competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and
experience that translates directly to paid employment. As part of the
application process, you must complete and submit an occupational
questionnaire. To preview this questionnaire and determine if your experience
matches the required skills for this position, click the following link: View Assessment Questions Please follow
all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating and/or
appointment eligibility. POSITIVE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: This position has a Positive Education Requirement. In order to
verify that you meet the positive education qualifications for
this position, you MUST submit a
complete copy of their transcripts or an itemized list of college courses which
includes equivalent information from the transcript (Course title,
semester/quarter hours and grade). Failure to submit this information
may result in an ineligible rating.  You may submit your transcripts or
list of college courses through the "Application Manager" or by
fax.  This is the only method in which transcripts can be submitted. 
Failure to provide this information may result in an ineligible rating. (Faxing
instructions may be found under the "How to Apply" section.) SUBSTITUTION OF EDUCATION FOR EXPERIENCE : Applicants may substitute the following education for the required
experience, provided it demonstrates the knowledge, skills and abilities
necessary to do the work of the position: FOR GS-7: In addition to meeting the
requirements for the GS-5 level, to qualify for GS-7 requires: 1. One year
of Professional engineering experience in the private or public sector such as:
Defining HM&E systems/equipment test requirements, specifications,
drawings, sketches, etc; Providing on-site inspections, evaluates and analyzes
NDT data, and provides technical engineering reports; Diagnosing substandard
performance of submarine systems and equipment, and specifies corrective
actions; Developing technical documents to be utilized in troubleshooting and
fault isolation, repair, testing, and recertification; Providing technical
input for resolution of departure from specifications requests associated with
repair and maintenance actions? 2. One year
of graduate level education at an accredited university/college. 3. Superior
academic achievement at the baccalaureate level in a professional engineering
curriculum. (Does not apply to Engineering Technology
Degrees) . 4. Completed
a 5 year program of study of at least 160 semester hours leading to a
bachelor's degree in engineering. 5. Professional
Engineering Degree with experience as an engineering technician equivalent to
grade GS-05 or higher. COMBINATION
OF EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Equivalent combinations of education and
experience may be combined to meet the total qualification requirements. Superior

How to Apply How to Apply To begin the process, click the Apply Online button to create an account or log in to your existing USAJOBS account.  Follow the prompts to complete the occupational questionnaire. Please ensure you click the Submit My Answers button at the end of the process. To apply for this position, you must provide a complete Application Package which includes: - Complete Resume. - Complete Assessment Questionnaire. View Occupational Questionnaire - Other supporting documentation as required.  Please see the " REQUIRED DOCUMENTS " section and review the applicant checklist link to determine if there are other documents you are required to submit. Your complete application (resume, assessment questionnaire, and all supporting documents) must be received by 11:59 pm Eastern Standard Time (EST) on Friday, July 08, 2016. Applications received after Friday, July 08, 2016may result in an ineligible rating and loss of consideration. If more than one resume is received, only the last resume received and processed will be reviewed. Note: To check the status of your application or return to a previous or incomplete application, log into your USAJOBS account: https://mydon.usajobs.gov/Account/Login select Application Status, and click on the more information link under the application status for this position.  You'll be directed to the Details page in Application Manager that will display the status of your application, documentation received and processed, and any correspondence related to this application. Your uploaded documents may take several hours to clear the virus scan process so please plan appropriately. ***You are encouraged to apply online. Applying online will allow you to review and track the status of your application.*** If you are unable to apply online or unable to upload your supporting documents follow the directions located at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/Application_Info_How_to_Apply_via_Fax.pdf Note: Faxing an application package (eg. 1203-FX) will not allow you to review and track the status of your application unless you have completed the application process in USAJOBS. This Vacancy ID is 1674302 Do not email or send hard copy resumes/applications to the Contact Information or Agency Information listed in this vacancy announcement.  All resumes/applications received at the addresses listed in the Contact Information or Agency Information will be destroyed and will not be considered for this vacancy announcement. **It is the applicant’s responsibility to verify that all information in their resume and documents, whether uploaded or faxed, are received, legible, and accurate.  HR will not modify answers/documents submitted by an applicant. ** How You Will Be Evaluated SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: A Secret security clearance is a requirement of this position. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a position offer or removal. A favorable ANACI (Access National Agency Check and Inquiries) background investigation is required for noncritical sensitive positions with access to network systems. Overtime may be required. Occasional travel (both domestic and foreign may be required to both naval and private facilities. The incumbent must Obtain/Maintain an IT-II level designation. Selectee will be required to complete Pathways Recent Graduate Program requirements. Selectee will be required to successfully complete a pre-appointment physical examination. Shipyard and shipboard work is required; incumbent will be required to climb, crawl and bend to accomplish shipboard inspections in a shipyard environment. Occasional shipboard visits require exposure to discomforts such as high noise levels, high temperatures, and adverse weather. Applications will be accepted from students who expect to complete qualifying education within 9 months from the date of application. However, agencies are required to verify that the education has been completed successfully before any applicant can be appointed (report to work); therefore, your selection or start date may be impacted by proof and completion of all Pathways requirements. If you meet the
qualification requirements, your application will be placed in one of three categories: Best Qualified- Candidates in this category possess exceptional skills and experience to exceed well above the minimum requirements for announced position. Well Qualified- Candidates in this category possess good skills and experience above the minimum requirements for announced position. Qualified- Candidates in this category meet the minimum experience requirements
for announced position. If, after reviewing your resume and supporting documentation, a determination is made that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience, your score may be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities or you may be found ineligible/not qualified. post_text: Information System Security Officer- Atlanta RSD 1078 - Georgia Tech Research Institute Information System Security Officer- Atlanta RSD 1078 Job Number: 1078 Job Classification: Research Faculty Areas of Expertise: CyberSecurity; Other Functional Roles: Information Technology Support; Management; Other Degree: Bachelor's; Master's Level of Experience: Junior; Mid Level Field of Study: Computer Engineering; Computer Science; Electrical Engineering; Other Rank: Research Associate I  (RAI); Research Associate II  (RAII) Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: All Close Date: 10/08/2016 Labs/Support Units: Research Security Department (RSD) Description: Job Classification: Research Faculty Areas of Expertise: Other Functional Roles: Other Degree: Bachelor's; Master’s Level of Experience: Junior; Mid-Level Salary: Based on Experience Field of Study: Computer Engineering; Computer Science; Electrical Engineering; Other Rank: Research Associate I (RAI); Research Associate II (RAII) Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: All 1078 Labs/Support Units: Research Security (RS), Atlanta, GA Description: Information System Security Officer This is a full time opportunity with GTRI’s Research Security Department in Atlanta, GA. The position is for an experienced Information Assurance Officer who has interest in intellectually challenging and rewarding work. We value bright, intellectually curious, growth oriented professionals and provide a work environment that allows work / life balance and opportunity for growth. INTERNAL TITLE: Research Associate I/II POSITION SUMMARY: Manage Information Security for a world class applied research organization. This position is for an Information System Security Officer (ISSO). The ISSO is responsible for managing all information system security requirements for GTRI accredited systems. The candidate will provide technical and security expertise to ensure system security requirements are properly configured and policies adhered to by privileged and general users. The successful candidate will have demonstrated deep technical and Industrial Security knowledge as well as provided comprehensive IA support through a system’s full lifecycle. In addition, the candidate should be able to research policies and regulations, productively interact with various agencies and levels of management, and contribute to establishing and maintaining accredited information systems. REQUIREMENTS THAT MUST BE MET TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION: US Citizenship AND the ability to get a security clearance At least 3 years of experience with BS in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or Information Assurance/Security Must possess or be willing to obtain CISSP, Security+, CISA, Linux+, MS Server, and/or other applicable certifications in compliance with DoD Directive 8570 guidance Should have experience with JSIG, RMF, DJSIG, ICD 503, JAFAN 6/3, NIST 800, NISPOM and ISFO. Experience providing COMSEC support and working with Controlled Cryptographic Items (e.g. key loading devices and encryptors). Experience with information systems Incident Response Teams Experience with or have worked as most of the following:  Linux Administrator (Linux+), Windows Administrator (all OSs including legacy systems), Generic/Proprietary System Administrator, Information System Auditor, Information Systems Security Officer/Engineer, Data Security Analyst, Network Control Technician. Experience identifying system vulnerabilities and implementing mitigation strategies. ADDITIONAL PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS Excellent written and verbal communication skills at all levels of an organization An active security clearance is a major plus CISSP or Security+ is preferred at the time of hire Experience in an environment and culture steeped in teamwork and collaboration working on challenging technical projects Project Management and  Leadership ABOUT GEORGIA TECH RESEARCH INSTITUTE GTRI is a great place for intellectually curious, world class technology oriented engineering and scientific talent to work. Our projects are challenging, expanding and cutting edge applied research. In addition we offer competitive pay, excellent benefits, professional growth, freedom for approved outside consulting, and a defined career growth strategy. GTRI employs over 950 world class engineers and scientists. We recruit talent from such diverse areas as: Cyber Security Jobs, Big Data Jobs and Data Intelligence Jobs, Computer Science Jobs, Software Engineering Jobs, High Performance Computing Jobs ( HPC Jobs ), Hardware Design Jobs, Embedded System Design Jobs, Communication Systems Design Jobs, High Speed Networks Jobs,  Electromagnetics Jobs ( EM Jobs ) including Radar Systems Jobs, Antenna Design Jobs, Electronic Warfare Jobs, Sensor Design Jobs, Intelligent Systems Jobs, Systems Engineering Jobs and others.

post_text: Linux Security Developer / Administrator (CTISL/SIS) - 1017 - Georgia Tech Research Institute Linux Security Developer / Administrator (CTISL/SIS) - 1017 Job Number: 1017 Job Classification: Research Faculty Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: All Close Date: 09/01/2016 Labs/Support Units: Cyber Technology and Information Security Laboratory (CTISL) Description: Linux Security Developer / Administrator CTISL- 1017 The Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) in Atlanta, GA is seeking an experienced Linux Security Developer / Administrator who has interest in intellectually challenging and rewarding work. We value bright, intellectually curious, growth oriented professionals and provide a work environment that allows work / life balance and opportunity for growth. GTRI employee about 2000 employees working in 8 labs across 14 locations with a main campus in Atlanta, Ga. This opportunity is with our Cyber Technology and Information Security Lab (CTISL) Cyber Technology and Information Security Laboratory (CTISL). CTISL conducts applied research focused on cyber threats and countermeasures, secure multi-level information sharing, resilient command and control network architectures, reverse engineering, vulnerability identification, and high performance computing and analytics. CTISL engineers develop and apply cutting edge technologies in computing, network architectures, signal and protocol analysis, network forensics, malware analysis, and reverse engineering (hardware and software) to solve the tough problems.  To learn more about CTISL, please visit http://www.gtri.gatech.edu/ctisl INTERNAL TITLE:  Research Engineer/Scientist I/II POSITION SUMMARY: Full lifecycle Linux deployment plus networking, SECURITY, hardware and other programming. This position is responsible for design, development, and administration of various SE Linux based activities.  The individual will work with other Linux engineers to meet the goals and objectives of various projects.  Development emphasis is centered around Multi-Level Security (MLS) solutions, labeled database implementations, identity management, web services and redundant, multi-tenant eservice environments.  The position will also require knowledge in administration of large (32+) node Beowulf clusters. Travel Required: 25% to 50% Travel, CONUS and OCONUS REQUIREMENTS THAT MUST BE MET TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION: US Citizenship AND/ OR the ability to get a security clearance BS in computer science, electrical engineering or related technical field, MS preferred. Experience in Linux configuration and administration. Experience with networking and configuration management will be required. Intermediate to indepth knowledge of SE Linux, Tomcat/Apache, and Oracle on Linux required. ADDITIONAL PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS Component level hardware expertise a plus. Experience in MLS, Java programming, and Postgress a definite plus. ABOUT GEORGIA TECH RESEARCH INSTITUTE The Georgia Tech Research Institute has been recognized as one of Atlanta’s Best Places to Work by the Atlanta Business Chronicle 4 of the last 5 years. summary: We help scientists make new discoveries, lawyers win cases, doctors save lives, and executives forge commercial relationships with their clients....
post_text: Job Description - IT Sec & Reg Controls Auditor (REL0000E) Go to the main content section. US | UK | Deutsch Welcome. You are not logged in. | My Account Options My Job Basket | Log In This service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. Your session will end in {1} minutes. Click OK to reset the timer to {0} minutes. You have been signed out. This service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity. Job Search My Jobpage Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | All Jobs Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - IT Sec & Reg Controls Auditor (REL0000E) Job Description IT Sec & Reg Controls Auditor - REL0000E RELX Corporate : NA-USA-GA-Alpharetta Description The purpose of this role is to perform detailed information technology audit reviews, internally to assess the Company’s risk factors and performance related to existing information technology and proposed information technology projects. The results of this work are reported to RELX Senior Management by the VP, IT Security & Regulatory Controls Assurance on a regular basis. This position is responsible for performing audits and internal testing of controls around both the ChoicePoint & Reed Elsevier FTC Orders, ChoicePoint AVC and other regulatory acts including, but not limited to, FCRA, DPPA, GLBA, and HIPAA/HITECH. Position Responsibilities: Executing test plans based on ISO27002 and reporting of internal testing for the FTC information security assessment for both Reed Elsevier and ChoicePoint FTC Orders under the direction and supervision of the Manager, IT Security & Regulatory Controls Assurance. The IT Security & Regulatory Controls Auditor shall execute and report information technology, privacy, and operational reviews with direct and indirect supervision from the Manager, IT Security & Regulatory Controls Assurance and the Senior IT Security & Regulatory Controls Auditor. As part of executing test plans, this position will conduct one-on-one interviews with Information Technology control owners to gain an understanding of the underlying information technology control environment. Execution of test plans will include data analysis of system user listings, log files, changes, etc to determine operating effectiveness of controls. Test plans will include detailed documentation including narratives of detailed test procedures, test results and description on internal controls. These reviews will identify business, privacy, security, compliance, information technology and regulatory risks, in addition to identifying cost savings opportunities and typically include the following type of reviews: application audits; network reviews; information security audits; system development life cycle (SDLC) reviews; regulatory and other compliance reviews (e.g., FCRA, DPPA, GLBA, HIPAA software licensing); and general information technology controls reviews. Fu During the internal assessment testing, this position will work closely with the third party auditor to ensure document requests are returned in a timely manner, and the documentation meets the needs of the third party auditor. Duties also include working with IADP management on existing and proposed information technology projects to integrate continuous auditing technologies such as audit hooks and integrated test facilities into these applications. Identifying control gaps and process improvements and communicating such to the Manager, IT Security & Regulatory Controls Assurance. Under the direction of the Manager, IT Security & Regulatory Controls Assurance, this position will work with the IADP Data Privacy Programs group for implementation of remediation and control improvement plans. Provide support, as needed, to the IADP Data Privacy Programs team regarding its maintenance of the inventory of applications and systems deemed in scope for the assessments, which will be updated at least semi-annually Ad-hoc assignments (analysis, audit committee meeting preparation, etc.) as required. RELX Group is a world-leading provider of information solutions for professional customers across industries. We help scientists make new discoveries, lawyers win cases, doctors save lives, and executives forge commercial relationships with their clients. We help insurance groups offer customers lower prices by assessing risk better, and save taxpayers and consumers money by enabling governments and financial groups to detect fraud. RELX Group employs approximately 29,000 employees and is present in more than 250 locations in 34 countries. Our customers are using our products every day to advance science, improve medical outcomes, enable better legal decisions, evaluate risk, forge business relationships and gain business insight. We put the highest priority on recruiting, developing and retaining outstanding people. Our managers are directly responsible for the development of their people. We recognize and reward achievement. We enjoy what we do and we celebrate success. We empower our people to maximize their potential and contribution. We respect our people and believe in open and honest communication. We behave in an ethical and principled manner. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. title: EW Model Developer & Analyst (Research Engineer/Scientist I/II) EOSL
summary: EW Model Developer and Analyst (Research Scientist I/II). Our team has a diversity of backgrounds and skillsets, and a typical project team is composed of...
post_text: EW Model Developer & Analyst (Research Engineer/Scientist I/II) EOSL  - Georgia Tech Research Institute EW Model Developer & Analyst (Research Engineer/Scientist I/II) EOSL Job Number: 1067 Job Classification: Research Faculty Areas of Expertise: Electronic Warfare Functional Roles: Software Design/Dev Degree: Bachelor's; Master's; PhD Level of Experience: Entry Level; Junior Field of Study: Computer Engineering; Computer Science; Electrical Engineering; Mathematics Rank: Research Engineer I (REI); Research Engineer II  (REII) Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: Full Time Close Date: 10/22/2016 Labs/Support Units: Electro-Optics Systems Laboratory (EOSL) Description: Description: Title: EW Model Developer and Analyst (Research Scientist I/II) Position: Full Time Level: Research Engineer/Scientist I/II Primary Location: Atlanta, GA Travel Required: Up to 25% time, but typically far less Lab: Electro-Optical Systems Laboratory (EOSL) Reporting To: Micah Coleman Job Description This job is for a full time research faculty position in the Electronic Warfare Analysis Branch (EWAB) within the Electro-Optical Systems Laboratory (EOSL) at Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI).  Responsibilities include developing innovative solutions for algorithms and waveforms, and developing models and simulations to support EW research. EWAB performs modeling, simulation, and analysis in support of various RF electronic warfare studies, including aircraft self-protection countermeasures, net-centric warfare, mission data support, and target tracking.  Our team has a diversity of backgrounds and skillsets, and a typical project team is composed of programmers, RF engineers, and radar experts.  While our work is applied research, it runs the gamut from "blue sky" concepts for the future battlespace to modeling-based solutions to be fielded on today's aircraft. We offer a flexible work environment allowing each researcher to pursue his or her interests and strengths, integrated with the overall mission of the branch and the lab.  If you have aspirations for an advanced degree, all the better.  Because GTRI is a research unit within Georgia Tech, you can get your graduate school paid for and pursue a degree in pretty much any engineering, science or math field you desire from a world class research institution.  We highly encourage our research developers to pursue advanced technical degrees and professional development courses. Requirements: Write software to model various EW systems Engage in collaborative development using modern configuration management tools (e.g. git, subversion) Assist in the design, development, and demonstration of EW simulation experiments Develop and integrate scripts to allow researchers to gather and analyze critical data from the simulation runs Perform and document analysis on the simulations to determine the efficacy of EW techniques and optimize the techniques Travel may be involved, as project work may occur in Atlanta or at a location other than Atlanta Education: B.S. M.S. or Ph.D in Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields Experience: 0-7 years of professional or graduate experience Preferred Skills: Matlab, C/C++, Python, Fortran Strong math skills and ability to learn complex engineering concepts Familiarity with Linux and open source tools Configuration management tools (git preferred) Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas to non-technical audience Ability to work independently as well as in a dynamic team environment Other: Candidate must be a US citizen capable of holding a Secret DoD security clearance, active clearance a major plus.

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Customer Support Change Control Manager (CLI0009I) Job Description Customer Support Change Control Manager - CLI0009I Elsevier : NA-USA-GA-Atlanta Description The Change Control Manager is responsible for ensuring and establishing process relating to defect management, engagement identified gaps / opportunities, client specific feedback and internal stakeholder (sales, product management, marketing) highlighted process issues.  The Manager is responsible for identifying key reports, system analytics specifically within our customer support system, Right Now that highlight opportunities for workflow improvement, contribute to the engagement team data to better manage activities, and communicate to internal and external stakeholders key metrics that are impacting the customer experience.  For defect management, this role will actively monitor and report customer defect incidents and requests for enhancements.  Specifically the role will represent the voice of the customer throughout the development cycle and coordinate with key product partners.  This position assists with directing the short and long term planning, control and monitoring of change control for key Clinical Solutions products. Main Activities and Responsibilities Change Control Management • Review defect incidents for complete information and prioritize defects in best interest of customer needs. • Represent voice of the customer in all release meetings for Clinical Solutions products. • Manage release communications and training with Customer Service teams to insure timely and accurate communication of maintenance and update releases. • Ensure delivery of internal and external training schedules for product releases. • Follow up on customer service defect items to ensure adequate customer communication and closure of incidents. • Report monthly defect activity, age, and schedule status for customer reported defects. Process Improvement • Identify process improvements with change management workflows across Clinical Solutions service teams. • Participate in projects focused on change control workflows. • Identify CRM and Incident Management solutions for recordkeeping and recording customer service activities. Customer Engagement Support and Usage • Support Engagement team with strategic account usage and process planning as needed • Identify workflow solution for recording customer engagement activities across products. Qualifications Education, Knowledge, Skills and Experiences Bachelor Degree in Business, Computer Technologies, Project Management, or other related area. Minimum of 1-3 years of demonstrated project management or administrative management experience. Proficient in all Microsoft office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Visio and Project. Familiarity with software development methodologies, .NET and SQL database processing, and Agile methodolgy preferred. Preferred Skill Level: 3-5 years experience with learning management systems and knowledge of AICC/SCORM 2-3 years online training and education experience 3-5 years experience with healthcare solutions and healthcare industry 3-5 years familiarity with online internet content delivery processes, and eLearning Elsevier is the world's leading provider of scientific, technical and medical (STM) information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Our breadth of content is unparalleled, spanning virtually every STM field in the world and includes such distinguished brands as Gray's Anatomy, The Lancet and Cell. Using innovative technology, we deliver our content through tools that help our customers be more productive and successful in their work. ScienceDirect delivers the worlds' leading journals electronically to over 11 million readers in 200 countries. And physicians in 95 percent of teaching hospitals rely on ClinicalKey to get critical information that can save lives. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. post_text: Job Details Skip Navigation Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account SR ANALYST USABILITY RESEARCH (92495) GA - Atlanta Share: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Apply with LinkedIn Position Description POSITION PURPOSE - The Usability Research Sr Analyst conducts usability testing, interviews, surveys and research for The Home Depot ecommerce products, which are available across several online platforms including traditional browser, phone, kiosk and tablet. By providing customer feedback through a variety of testing and research methods and providing actionable insights and study findings, this position helps drive revenue and ensure the online products are as easy and intuitive to use as possible. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Usability, the Usability Research Sr Analyst will plan and conduct tests/research using a variety of methods and tools on the live site, simulations and comps. Findings Reports are provided to a variety of stakeholders including Senior Management, Product Management, Strategy, and Product Design. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES - Schedule, define, plan and execute testing and research; including but not limited to recruited and trending surveys, in-lab and remote usability testing, heuristic evaluations, usability reviews, comp set analysis, ethnographic studies, reports and article collection/ summarization, task analysis, contextual inquires, and identification of customer behavioral patterns. - Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize testing questions based on analysis of current knowledge, project goals and risks. - Analyze study data, create and present reports to appropriate stakeholders. Serve as an expert consultant by reviewing concepts and designs for ease of use, and communicating usability best practices. - Design research protocols, templates and processes for variety of qualitative and quantitative analysis. - Establish and manage a database of interview and survey participants. - Create and manage programs to gather participants. - Contribute to and help manage the Usability team site/blog/wiki. - Provide strategic direction, monitor feedback and collaborate with analytic team members to support the online customer feedback survey processes. NATURE AND SCOPE - Position reports to the Manager, Online Product Design - No direct responsibility for supervising others. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS - Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. ESSENTIAL SKILLS MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS - Minimum bachelors degree in HCI, human factors, psychology or similar field with specific usability research related work experience required - Must be eighteen years of age - Must pass the Drug Test - Must pass the Background Check - Must pass pre-employment tests if applicable EDUCATION REQUIRED - The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE - 05 PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS - Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS - 5+ years experience in usability testing, survey/customer feedback strategy, and other related disciplines within an e-commerce environment End-to-end experience with all aspects of research (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting) - Strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g.: study plans, reports) Prior experience with primary and secondary research methodologies KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND COMPETENCIES - Strong communication, presentation, organization, time management and interpersonal skills - Effective cross-function collaboration skills - Ability to maintain strong rapport with teammates, and stakeholders from multiple business groups - Proven ability working in fast paced environment with shifting priorities while managing tactical deliverables and meeting deadlines Date Posted: Jun 4, 2015 Functional Area: E-Commerce Company: The Home Depot Position Type: Full-Time Travel: 0-25% Relocation Provided: No Apply with LinkedIn Back to top We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Job Description of Marketing Research Analyst – Manufacture • Plan and execute regional customer and marketing research for strategy and product planning • Design research plan, develop questionnaires and other research tools • Conduct research (qualitative and quantitative) and perform analyses using statistical software (SPSS) • Leverage insights and data to draw conclusions to provide actionable recommendations • Design methods to capture needed market research data to identify market, segmentation and research objectives • Monitor effectiveness of marketing and promotions programs to assist developing market strategic plans and improve market penetration • Complete competitive assessment of industry landscape to understand competitors’ capabilities and solutions • Make recommendations on research methodology, based on results of preliminary analyses, to achieve business goals and objectives • Other job duties are assigned as required Job Requirements of Marketing Research Analyst – Manufacture • Bachelor Degree with Marketing, Business, Statistics, or related filed • 1 years of Market Research Firm or Marketing roles preferably in the manufacturing environment • Excellent communication skills • SPSS or other statistical software experience • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint • Organized and time management skills • Some travel is required including internationally (15%) This position includes manufacturing and warehousing work environment. While performing the duties of this job you may be required to intermittently sit, stand, walk, lift up to 25 pounds, lift in excess of 25 pounds with a lift assist, climb stairs, use hands to handle or feel parts/equipment, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend at the waist, talk and hear. You may also be required to use close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and peripheral vision. We screen ALL Candidates to verify the validity of each applicant with criminal background / Social Security verification - some positions require drug screening and vehicle driving reports. Upon submitting your resume, we will contact only those candidates that we deem qualified for our client. If we do not contact you, we do not see the fit for the position. If we are unable to reach you in a reasonable timeframe, you will be eliminated from the pool of potential candidates. Direct applicants only. We do not accept any resumes from any third party organizations or other recruiters. Apply Job Tools Follow Company Your information may be shared with the company. title: Civil Designer with Site Development or Transportation Experience
summary: From engineers to urban planners and scientists to surveyors, WK Dickson offers its clients a vast network of talent and passion....
post_text: W.K. Dickson & Co., Inc. W.K. Dickson & Co., Inc. Civil Designer with Site Development or Transportation Experience Atlanta, GA   30339 Company Overview: WK Dickson believes that our people are our most valuable asset. From engineers to urban planners and scientists to surveyors, WK Dickson offers its clients a vast network of talent and passion. WK Dickson’s people are the best in the business, and our success comes from the personal drive of each of us. Our firm was built on the philosophy that people do business with people they like. That goes for our coworkers, too. We work hard. We take risks. We succeed together. Job Responsibilities: WK Dickson seeks a technology minded professional that enjoys being given responsibility as part of a team based approach to successful project execution.  We are looking for a candidate with civil Site Development or Transportation experience with a passion for learning to join our aviation team. Analyze and organize project data with accuracy, neatness, and timeliness while utilizing appropriate software applications. Work from sketches, notes and other input material to produce computer generated graphs, charts, overlays and completed drawings. Can complete finished product with limited direction. Understand and follow company standard Civil 3D procedures for layering, etc., and standard drawing procedures for sheet layout. Suggest improvements to standard procedures. Develop and maintain Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. Search, investigate, and select technical reference data pertinent to a project. Prepare and assist with developing project computations, estimates, surveys, statistics, and designs. Prepare calculations within practice area. Deliver projects to clients. Maintain technical coordination with staff. Maintain positive communication with staff, clients and subcontractors. Follow general instructions and company policies and procedures. Comply with all company safety policies and rules. Perform additional duties as assigned. Job Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited university. 2 to 5 years of experience in one or more of our practice areas, Aviation a plus Engineering Intern (EI) designation Analytical skills with ability to prepare statistical reports. Ability to work well independently and on a team. Ability to communicate ideas and technical information to staff, supervisors and clients in a professional manner. Travel as necessary to meet the needs of the position. Company Benefits: Employees are able to take advantage of our: Exclusive ‘Talent Development Program’ Project Management Curriculum Leadership Retreats Mentoring Program In addition WK Dickson offers its employees a competitive benefits package including: Competitive salaries Medical, dental, prescription drug, and vision care plans Matching 401K program Life insurance Short and long term disabilities benefits Supplemental insurance option Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy Paid Holidays Continuing education / tuition reimbursement Professional registration reimbursement Flexible spending account (FSA) Performance-based incentives Spot bonuses Employee referral bonuses Flex-time policy (half-day Fridays) Moving and relocation assistance Business casual work environment Company-sponsored social events Community giving and charitable programs Specific programs vary by region, in accordance with the competitive environments of local areas. Accessibility: If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process please contact us at 704-334-5348 Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans. Influence and govern current and strategic architectural blueprints. Promote architectural initiatives that drive revenue and improve efficiency aligned with business strategy. assigned tasks to project teams and managers Provide technical leadership and motivation to junior developers Qualifications 15+ years of IT experience with hands-on experience in application/system/platform/integration architectures Experience building reporting applications using commercial and open source frameworks Expert knowledge of Java 8, JVM ecosystem, memory model, tuning, threading, reactive streams, modularization Knowledge of Domain Driven Design concepts and microservices Expert knowledge of Spring ecosystem (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Spring Integration, Spring Cloud Data Flow etc Knowledge of NoSQL data stores and polyglot persistence (MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, CouchDB) In depth knowledge of distributed systems concepts Knowledge of event sourcing and distributed message systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ) API design and implementation (remote vs local APIs, routing and reverse proxying, load balancing, optimization techniques) Knowledge of distributed computing, in memory computing, map/reduce frameworks (Spark), streaming (Storm, Samza) Expert knowledge of build tools and dependency management (gradle, maven) Understanding of the testing pyramid (unit, functional, integration, system, API testing) and testing approaches TDD, BDD In depth hands on experience with virtualization approaches (VMs, containers, unikernels) Hands on experience with cloud based IaaS (OpenStack, AWS) and distributed schedulers (Kubernetes, Mesos) Expert knowledge of Unix OS, tuning, command line utilities Comfortable to operate in an agile, dynamic environment Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Medical Technologist (Per Diem/Days) (5178) Job Description Medical Technologist (Per Diem/Days) ( Job Number: 5178 ) Description Job Summary Provides accurate and timely laboratory information based on the performance of analytical tests on human body substances. Correlates and interprets test data. This is done to detect evidence of or prevent disease or impairment and to promote and monitor good health. Monitors quality assurance and maintains laboratory instrumentation including all documentation. Follows established guidelines and protocols to provide requested clinical information to Physicians, nurses, and other relevant health care personnel. Orients and trains new employees. In the absence of direct supervision is able to temporarily act as a designated person in charge. All activities will be performed in support of the strategy, vision, and values of Phoebe. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. All activities must be in compliance with Equal Employment Opportunity laws, HIPAA, ERISA, and other regulations, as appropriate. General requirements Performs all job responsibilities in alignment with the core values, mission and vision of the organization Performs other duties as required and completes all job functions as per departmental policies and procedures Maintains current knowledge in present areas of responsibility (i.e., self education, attends ongoing educational programs) Attends staff meetings and completes mandatory in-services and requirements and competency evaluations on time. Demonstrates competency at all levels in providing care to all patients based on age, sex, weight, and demonstrated needs. For non-clinical areas, has attended training and demonstrates usage of age- specific customer service skills. Wears protective clothing and equipment as appropriate. Adheres to the hospital and departmental attendance and punctuality guidelines Working Conditions General environment: Works in a well-lighted, air-conditioned area, with moderate noise levels. May be exposed to limited hazardous substances or body fluids, or infectious organisms. May be required to change from one task to another of different nature without loss of efficiency or composure. Periods of high stress and fluctuating workloads may occur. May be scheduled as needed including overtime Qualifications Education Requirements 2 year / Associate Degree in Allied Health (Required) 4 year / Bachelor's Degree in Natural Science or related field (Preferred) ;In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree; an Associate Degree and a Minimum of 4 years additional relevant experience is acceptable. Experience Requirements 0 - 1 year Ability to perform in one or more laboratory departments as a clinical laboratory scientist.(Preferred) General Skills Organizational Skills,Communication Skills,Interpersonal Skills,Customer Relations,Mathematical,Analytical,Grammar / Spelling,Read / Comprehend Written Instructions,Follow Verbal Instructions,Basic Computer Skills. Physical Requirements Have near normal hearing; Hear alarms/telephone/tape recorder/normal speaking voice Have near normal vision: Clarity of vision (both near and far), ability to distinguish colors Have good manual dexterity Have good eye-hand-foot coordination Ability to perform repetitive tasks/motion Physical Demands Occasionally within shift (1-33%) : Bending/Stooping,Twist at waist,Pushing/Pulling. Frequently within shift (34-66%) : Standing,Walking,Sitting. Certifications and Licensures Required Certifications/Licensures : Medical Technologist (MT-ASCP).

post_text: TWC PRODUCT DESIGNER - Job Details Toggle header links Toggle search controls Back Job search Sign in/Register Primary job category Travel Required City / Township / Village Country Close in Share 0 TWC PRODUCT DESIGNER 35948BR Job Description Position Summary We’re looking for a Product Designer to join our talented team. Does the thought of creating the next generation products for The Weather Channel’s 100 million users get you excited? Do you think weather is so much more than just a conversation starter? Do you have the curiosity of a scientist and the passion of an artist, and are you a creative problem solver, a craftsman, a delight to work with? If this sounds like you, then read on! As a Product Designer, you’ll be involved in every aspect of the product creation process, from brainstorming the next great innovation to tweaking pixels before launch (and beyond). You’ll utilize your unicorn range of ux design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you’ll collaborate with other smart folks on the design of our products across responsive web and native apps. At TWC we use science, data and user-driven insights to guide our work, but we also believe in a healthy dose of inspired storytelling as we strive to transform the landscape of weather products. Your day-to-day is never the same: Fast paced, often fun and never boring. What you’ll do: Strategy & Discovery Contribute to the user experience from inception to launch Come up with bold and smart ideas that help solve user and business needs Turn ideas into experiences that are feasible, valuable and delightful Actively participate in discovery activities to help define products and features Take part in ideation workshops and design studios and help with requirement gathering Develop and help present proof of concepts to stakeholders Design Sketch and prototype to quickly iterate on ideas Execute high/low fidelity wireframes and user flows that promote ease of use Create interaction models and UI details that optimize the user experience Work with user research and product managers on user testing Design visually arresting interfaces that push past the obvious and delight our fans around the globe Champion TWC brand and work with other designers to own, uphold and document design standards Prioritize work effectively and collaborate with product managers, developers, research and designers as needed Comfortably give and take design feedback Great candidate will have: Experience & Skills 2-3 year+ brand or agency experience as Product Designer, Interaction Designer, UX/UI Designer, interactive Art director or a related field Experience with native app design and / or responsive web A well rounded point of view on user experience – Product design is not just about visual design or just about IA Strong design aesthetic and the ability to generate ideas Ability to employ design thinking methods to solve problems Experience working in interdisciplinary teams Proficient knowledge of design and prototyping tools Experience with user research and usability testing methods a plus An understanding of the latest web / app development technologies Knowledge of some front end coding a big plus. Killer portfolio that proves you’re making something you love. Qualities Desire to make the best products in the industry hands-down Infectious curiosity — always looking for opportunities to learn new things Self Motivation, an open mind and a sense of humor Good communication skills – Candid, honest and above all thoughtful and kind Still sounds like you? If so we’d LOVE  to hear from you! TWC Primary job category Design & Product Management Secondary Job Category Design Role ( Job Role ) Designer Employment Type Full-Time Remote work possible? No Required Technical and Professional Expertise 2-3 year+ brand or agency experience as Product Designer, Interaction Designer, UX/UI Designer, interactive Art director or a related field Experience with native app design and / or responsive web Strong design aesthetic and the ability to generate ideas Experience working in interdisciplinary teams Proficient knowledge of design and prototyping tools An understanding of the latest web / app development technologies Preferred Technical and Professional Experience Experience with user research and usability testing methods a plus Knowledge of some front end coding a big plus. Eligibility Requirements n/a Required Education High School Diploma/GED Preferred Education Bachelor's Degree Travel Required No Travel IBM Business Group Analytics Is this role a commissionable/sales incentive based position? MATRIX: Technology Consulting, Staffing & Recruiting Solutions MATRIX Home Job Seekers Solutions Professional Staffing Agile Consulting Application Development UI/UX Telecom Global Delivery Client Work Resources Blogs Events Salary Survey Tech Trends About Overview Locations Consultants Benefits Payroll Training FAQ Contact Digital Research Analyst Contract Position in Atlanta, Georgia Post Date: 04/04/2016 Rate:

                                Not Specified Reference: Job # 106875 Industry leader seeks a Digital Research Analyst too support the Digital Research & Analytics team and will be responsible for dashboard creation, data visualization and automation of reporting for all digital platforms and products on a 6 month contract in the Atlanta area.  The analyst will also assist with weekly and monthly competitive reporting. Responsibilities: Designs dashboards and data presentations leveraging CNN’s suite of analytics and syndicated tools. Works with technical resources and key research stakeholders to gather reporting requirements, create prototypes and build final outputs. Updates and distributes regular reports and dashboards that focus on product and content performance across the client’s entire business portfolio. Builds automation into existing reports that are manually distributed. Required Skills: 1 - 2 years of experience with analytics software; Adobe Reporting (Omniture); comScore would be a plus. Thorough understanding of digital metrics. Passion for learning new tools and visualizing data outputs. Attention to detail and accuracy in compiling and analyzing data is a must. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Solid time management skills and ability to work on multiple projects, prioritize and consistently deliver on time. Interest in digital news and information industry trends. 1 - 2 years of experience in digital analytics or related role. Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills. About MATRIX For more than 30 years, MATRIX has helped talented technology professionals get ahead in an ever-changing marketplace. Whether you are actively pursuing new job opportunities, or simply seeking market insight or career advice, we have you covered. Our outstanding benefits package includes optional medical, dental, vision and disability insurance, as well as free and discounted skills training. The MATRIX team also offers more personalized services such as career advice, resume customization and interview preparation - keeping the focus on you, your career, and how best to assist you on your journey. So whatever your career destination, we’re how you get there. Please Note: Your resume will never be submitted to a client company without your prior knowledge and consent to do so. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Data Scientist Intern (165136) Job Description Data Scientist Intern ( Job Number: 165136 ) Cox Enterprises Description Job:  Associate Data Scientist – BI (Intern) Job Description The role of Associate Data Scientist will be responsible for providing analysis of data and creating insights to business problems. This role will develop statistical models, create reports of findings, and create data visualizations.  The analyst will develop an in depth understanding of databases, SQL, SAS and Tableau tools. They will be strong team player with the ability to work and communicate with technical and non-technical resources and customers.  This position requires a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience. This role has no direct reports. Experience with data science. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES · Participate in requirements definition sessions · Perform analysis as required for data driven projects · Assist Project Managers in developing alternative solutions to meet user requirements · Build SAS Data models · Create data visualizations using Tableau · Troubleshoot technical issues Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS: · Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or related field, OR equivalent work experience · Strong analytical skills · SAS or R Skills · The ability to analyze large amounts of data and produce business insight · Proven ability to work at the direction of a lead person but must also possess leadership skills · Ability to meet project deadlines · Ability to manage deliverables and milestones · Strong organizational and analytical skills · Strong verbal and written communication skills · Experience with Tableau data visualization tool and Stats tools Cox Enterprises is a leading communications, media and automotive services company. With revenues of nearly $20 billion and more than 50,000 employees, the company's major operating subsidiaries include Cox Communications, Inc. (cable television distribution, telephone, high-speed Internet access, wireless services, commercial telecommunications and advertising solutions); Manheim, Inc. (vehicle auctions, repair and certification services and web-based technology products); Cox Media Group, Inc. (television and radio stations, digital media, newspapers, advertising sales rep firms, Valpak and Cox Digital Solutions); and AutoTrader.com (online automotive advertising and Kelley Blue Book, vAuto, HomeNet Automotive and VinSolutions subsidiaries). Additionally, Cox operates Kudzu.com. More information about Cox can be found online at www.coxenterprises.com .  Cox Enterprises and its affiliated companies participate in the E-Verify program of the United States Department of Homeland Security.  For more information on the E-Verify program, please see the posters accessible through the links at: www.coxenterprises.com/careers/search-jobs.aspx Cox Enterprises and its subsidiaries do not contact candidates for employment by text message. We do not conduct online interviews via chat sessions and/or instant messenger applications. Cox utilizes a formal application process through the HR department and company websites. Communications are made through official company channels including email, letterhead, phone, and fax. The company does not require employees to purchase equipment or software as terms of employment. Interested candidates should submit their resume though Cox Career Network.  Cox Enterprises, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer .
