post_text: Statistician I job - Select Source International - Roswell, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Statistician I Select Source International - Roswell, GA Contract SELECT SOURCE INTERNATIONAL Select Source International (SSI) has been serving major corporations for more than 15 years. At SSI, we believe in building a corporation with only the strongest and most capable individuals. Our world-class consultants have the expertise to meet our clients’ demands. Here at SSI, we pride ourselves on the fundamental belief that our team is essential to our company's growth. We assist our consultants every step of the way in order to match them to the best possible position for their skills. Position : Statistician I Duration : 9 Months + Extension Location : Roswell, GA Job Description: The Statistician supports project learning by designing experiments that efficiently and effectively address project needs and analyzing/interpreting results. They consult with other statisticians within the department and work with test method development scientists to understand method intention and guide method evaluation. KEY CUSTOMERS: Sector Management, Project Sponsors, R&E project teams, External Technical Consultants, and Technical Service Providers CUSTOMER EXPECTATIONS: Partner with R&E project teams to design experiments to efficiently evaluate product characteristics utilizing appropriate testing methods. Utilize creative approaches in designing, analyzing and interpreting experiments. Contribute to discussions regarding interpretation and next steps. Document method development and product evaluation experiments in interpretive reports. Understand and effectively use the systems and tools utilized to process and analyze data from product research testing Carry out project responsibility with limited assistance and direction Carry out all work ensuring effective Safety and Quality attitudes and practices. Implement projects and programs with excellence to deliver research project objectives. Manage self in accordance with the expected One Client behaviors. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Advanced degree (Master’s) in Statistics related major / discipline 0-3 years of work experience utilizing Advanced Statistics methods Successful engagement in team-oriented environment to successfully deliver business results PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Demonstrated ability of writing and presenting updates to leadership. Specific experience designing and analyzing bench testing of non-food consumer products CRITICAL SKILLS: Understanding of statistical analysis methods and experimental design and ability to transform statistical results into actionable knowledge. Proficiency with SAS. Ability to synthesize information across recent and historical testing. Ability to explain complex information in a simple to understand way – written and verbal – within project teams and at times in non-technical settings. Strong knowledge and demonstrated ability in translating product development project needs into experimental design. Ability to contribute innovative ideas in a team environment. Effective Communication Skills with the ability to discuss technical issues in a business environment (research project teams, suppliers, management, etc.). Flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing business priorities and assignments. Application/Results orientation with primary focus on problem definition and generation of alternative solutions. Customer Focus when dealing with internal and external customers. Demonstrated experience effectively following engineering procedures and processes. WORKING CONDITIONS: Normal office conditions/ 0-10% travel etc. On-site testing labs and product development project teams. Thanks and Regards Kranthi Kumar Technical Recruiter Select Source International USA: 6311 Wayzata Blvd; Suite 150, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55416 (Phone: 952-546-3300 Ext: 5010 - Office) * Email: KranthiCatselectsourceintldotcom; Website: www.selectsourceintl.com Disclaimer: Select Source International (SSI) does not tolerate discrimination against any applicant on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, disability, age, sexual preference or any other protected status designated by federal, state or local law. It is SSI’s policy to affirmatively recruit, hire, train, assign, transfer, evaluate, compensate, provide benefits, promote, demote, layoff, recall, and terminate employees on their own abilities, achievements and experiences. This policy applies to all SSI employee activities. SSI encourages diversity in hiring, recognizing that this enriches the work environment for all SSI associates and that a broad variety of perspectives enhances decision-making and creativity. SSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.                     Big Data Jobs at AT&T Change the way the world connects Looking to do something amazing? Our Big Data team is made up of top innovators, cool technology and a start-up culture. Here, you’ll work with one of the largest data sets in the world to shape the way we interact with our customers. It’s a big opportunity with even bigger rewards. Share Share this job with your friends and connections! Job Details Culture Apply now Apply now Professional Big Data Software Eng BIG DATA Location: Roswell, Georgia Responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies. Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM are desirable. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Uses Big Data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented. Works in a highly agile environment. Job Contribution: Fully functioning technical professional. Develops new concepts/methods/techniques. Has meaningful team/dept impact. KNOWLEDGE Subject matter expert within own discipline/specialty area. Applies specialized knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards and work processes. Integrates company experience and deep technical knowledge. Advanced understanding of select AT&T technologies/systems/procedures. ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Solves non routine problems based on analysis of multiple factors. Independently identifies key issues, patterns or deviations from norm. Works on problems requiring judgment and in depth evaluation of multiple factors. Analyzes/interprets research to evaluate and recommend solutions. INDEPENDENCE Guided by team goals and operational objectives. Applies judgment to determine appropriate processes and technical area standard; provides technical direction to others in own work area. CONTRIBUTION TO AT&T TECHNOLOGY Key contributor on diverse projects of moderate scope. Recommends new procedures/processes to drive desired results. COMMUNICATION Mentors less experienced team members in work area explaining advanced technical information and providing specialized technical guidance. Builds productive internal/external relationships. Collaborates with others in own team or across teams. Education: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred. Experience: Typically requires 3-5 years experience. title: Director, Key Accounts
summary: Florence (florencehc.com) helps advance cures by making clinical trial document management compliant and simple....
post_text: Director, Key Accounts job - Florence Healthcare - Atlanta, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Director, Key Accounts Florence Healthcare - Atlanta, GA $250,000 a year General Summary What we do Florence (florencehc.com) helps advance cures by making clinical trial document management compliant and simple. Why? Successful clinical trials yield new therapies and improve the lives of patients around the world. Unfortunately, cumbersome tasks slow this progress: According to Tuft’s University, workload has doubled in the last 10 years, much of it due to document and data management. The Florence eBinder Suite™ eliminates wasted documentation effort, allowing research teams to spend more time producing great research and caring for patients. The Director, Key Accounts will create a new division of the company with the express purpose of finding, winning and caring for our most important customers. You will be responsible for generating qualified opportunities, securing new accounts and managing relationships. You’ll own a key area of our business, plan it’s strategic approach and define its potential. Responsibilities Get out there: Reach out to top 100 academic sites and pharmaceutical companies. Understand current practices, analyze their problems and introduce digital solutions including the eBinder Suite™ Create output: Set goals, break those goals into manageable bites and then go crush those goals Help those advancing clinical research: Provide product training support and troubleshooting Help shape the path of Florence: Work with our C-suite to build the strategic direction of the business Travel: 30% to visit potential customers and partners Experience Minimum qualifications Bachelor’s Degree preferably in a technical or life science field Ability to proactively seek and assess opportunities, plan, implement and evaluate results Track record of closing 100k+ revenue deals Competence with financial models and forecasts Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills Something special: Have something about you that no one else has. Desirable qualifications, you are A hard charger—you’ve hit brick walls and busted through them. You’re up for a challenge The outgoing one. In your life so far you’ve been the one leading the charge, planning the event and making the toast. Wallflowers need not apply. Comfortable with chaos: We’re growing fast and making a dent in the universe. You’re up for running faster than is comfortable What’s in it for you? Do good: We insist that health technology is the highest calling for software development. We pride ourselves on working on something bigger than ourselves; helping save lives Do well: We offer exceptional salary + equity compensation, 401(k), meals at the office, the PC setup of your choice and office space in the heart of town, Medical and dental insurance Work with the best: The Florence team consists of a Berkeley MBA grad, a Comp Sci master’s grad, an Emory doctor, a Georgia Tech biomedical engineer, and a rocket scientist. You’ll get to learn from and work with the best using the latest tech stack Make the leap: Join our high-output culture to create innovative, modern, and purposeful software solutions Kick ass and take names: Make progress for the sake of cures. You’re the CEO of your job Florence Healthcare supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class. title: Research Associate- Sample Processing
summary: Ensure on-going data integrity for the project by overseeing data collection, data management, quality control and reporting of results....
post_text: Research Associate- Sample Processing job - Akesogen, Inc. - Norcross, GA | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Research Associate- Sample Processing Akesogen, Inc. - Norcross, GA Job Title: Research Associate – sample processing This individual is a Research Associate who will work with a team of research associates and scientist at AKESOgen. The Research Associate will work under the general direction of a Team Lead. This individual will perform extractions on a variety of sample types, equipment maintenance, solution and reagent preparation in addition to other tasks in laboratory. All duties are subject to change by managers during employment. The following is an outline and is not intended to be inclusive of all tasks that could be requested of employee. Duties and responsibilities: Assist in assembling sample collection kits and inventory management. Collect samples from client site per schedule. Accession samples with accuracy and process PBMC samples, aliquot and store them per protocol. Ensure on-going data integrity for the project by overseeing data collection, data management, quality control and reporting of results. Maintains a clean, safe, and organized lab. A team player helping to construct, implement, and manage multiple experiments. Operate automated liquid handling platforms for sample processing, DNA/RNA extraction and quantification instruments. Assist the team leads and scientists in related function. Assist in tracking, stocking and restocking inventory. Complete projects under guidance of senior lab personnel. Understand and follow OSHA, CLIA and CAP guidelines. Maintain instrumentation and the appropriate documentation for each instrument. Demonstrate a high level of ethics in all aspects of professional practice. Demonstrate commitment to quality and continuous improvement. Assist with the development of research newsletters, presentations, and reports as needed. Required Skills and Education: Bachelor's degree in a clinical, health or life sciences field required. Minimum one year of experience in laboratory setting required. Previous experience in Nucleic acid extraction, PBMC processing and biorepository/Bio-banking is a plus. Excellent practical knowledge about the applications of scientific principles. Ability to work well in a group as well as carry out individual assignments. A basic knowledge of good laboratory practices plus analytical and decision-making ability. Effective oral and written communication skills, computer skills, and organizational ability required. Ability to focus for long periods on a task, able to lift 50lbs, and willingness to learn. Knowledge of LIMS system. Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record. Job Location Norcross, Georgia Position Type Full-Time/Regular Shift Description 11am-7pm The position requires work during Week Days. Occasional weekends if required. post_text: Job Details Skip Navigation Sign In to access application status, saved documents and Job Search Agents Job Details View Job Cart (0) Send This Job to a Friend View My Account Sr. Data Analyst - Supply Chain (94914) GA - Atlanta Share: Facebook LinkedIn Twitter Apply with LinkedIn Position Description Position Purpose : A Sr Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages proven technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively among other talented analysts to apply established and create new analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeks out opportunities to learn new and hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and operates under minimal supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists. • Analyzes key transportation and supply chain dynamics to achieve operational objectives, superior customer service-levels, and optimal costs • Leverages database management skills and critical thinking to develop ad hoc reporting and conduct analysis on supply chain synchronization and optimization projects • Develops and manages key relationships with transportation service providers and cross-functional partners to operate and optimize The Home Depot’s transportation network, supply chain, and end-to-end business Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities: 30%-Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests 20%-Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities 20%-Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail 20%-Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture 10%-Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group Nature and Scope: This position reports to Manager or Sr Manager This position has no Direct Reports Environmental Job Requirements: Environment:  Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel:  Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. Additional Minimum Qualifications : Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. Work Experience Required: 2 Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Additional Qualifications : B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance, or related quantitative field. Work experience with MS Excel, MS Access, SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems. Preferred Qualifications: 2-4 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting. An intermediary understanding of SQL or working directly with MS Access joining relational tables together and/or some knowledge of one other scripting/compiled/statistical programming language (e.g. VBA, Python, R, SAS, .NET, C++, Java, etc.) Experience building reports/analyses with analytical tools (e.g. Excel, JMP, SAS, Mathematica, SPSS, Tableau, etc.) Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.) Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies : Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving. An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data. Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way. Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment. Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques. title: Operations Research Analyst (EHA-ACQ-DAWDF)
summary: Ability to develop and utilize data collection techniquesand to analyze data. Feed all documents into your fax machine top first so that we receive them right...
post_text:
Operations Research Analyst (EHA-ACQ-DAWDF) Details Skip Navigation Operations Research Analyst (EHA-ACQ-DAWDF) Reference Code 1905924 Date posted 04/03/2016 Department: AF Civilian Force Renewal and Development Agency: Air Force Personnel Center Job Announcement Number: BI15-EHA-1610994-1515-JHV SALARY RANGE: $40,033 to $52,043 Per Year OPEN PERIOD: Wednesday, January 27, 2016 to Friday, September 30, 2016 SERIES & GRADE: GS-1515-07/07 POSITION INFORMATION: Full Time PROMOTION POTENTIAL: 12 DUTY LOCATIONS: Robins AFB, GA Andrews AFB, MD Wright-Patterson AFB, OH WHO MAY BE CONSIDERED: United States Citizens AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT: The mission of the United States Air Force is to fly, fight and win...in air, space and cyberspace. To achieve that mission, the Air Force has a vision of Global Vigilance, Reach and Power. That vision orbits around three core competencies: Developing Airmen,Technology-to-Warfighting and Integrating Operations. Core competencies and distinctive capabilities are based on a shared commitment to three core values-- integrity first, service before self, and excellence in all we do. JOB SUMMARY: KEY REQUIREMENTS: U.S. Citizenship Security Clearance Mobility Agreement Expedited Hiring Authority (EHA) DUTIES: -Utilizes statistical techniques and developing mathematical models in order to define and analyze problems. -Observes and participates in cost analysis assignments by performing a variety of routine taskings associated with the preparation of system cost analyses. -Extracts and organizes raw cost data under the supervision of an experienced analyst, and assists other analysts in the collection, development, and implementation of cost-related information. -Assists with  research of considerable scope and complexity for the development of analytical methods and techniques necessary for accurate cost estimates. -Observes and participates in identifying analytical concepts, methods and techniques, e.g. regression analysis, sensitivity analysis, linear programming, etc. appropriate to systems costing. -Observes and assists in validating and testing research findings for inclusion in high priority studies and proposals which are often presented to the Defense Acquisition Board (DAB), OSD Cost Analysis Improvement Group (CAIG), Air Force CAIG, and the Secretariat. -On a limited level, observes and assists in the analysis of problems related to the development of costing models, data sources, and techniques. - Participates with senior analysts in the preparation and maintenance of statistical information work sheets, cost data records and related correspondence. Other duties include  gathering and inputting data into computers, drafting portions of and proofing reports and briefings, and assisting in the design of and preparing visual aids. QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: SPECIALIZEDEXPERIENCE:     One year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-05 grade level. Specialized experience is defined as knowledge of utilizing statistical techniques and developing mathematical models in order to define and analyze problems; and advising officials of different approaches as a basis for management plans and decisions. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including
volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps,
AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic;
religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical
competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and
experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying
experience, including volunteer experience. To view qualifying educational requirements and/or combination of education and specialized experience, click on the following link: http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/standards/indexes/num-ndx.asp FEDERAL TIME-IN-GRADE (TIG)Requirement for General Schedule (GS) Positions: Applicants must have served at least 52 weeks at the GS-07 or higher grade (or equivalent in an alternate paysystem) within the Federal Civil Service to be considered for referral. The purpose of TIG restrictions is to prevent excessively rapid promotions incompetitive service GS positions and to protect competitive principles. Qualified candidates will be considered in accordance with the Office of Personnel Management Pathways Guidelines . You can also visit: http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/standards/index-Standards.asp for additional qualification standards. Once the application and selection process is complete,a review of your application will be made to ensure you meet the applicable OPMqualification requirements. To determine if you are qualified for this job, areview of your resume and supporting documentation will be made. Applicants whofail to provide the necessary documentation to support their educational gradepoint average/masters degree requirements, qualifying experience or veterans'preference claim will be determined incomplete, ineligible or not identified asclaiming veterans' preference. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errorsor omissions may affect your consideration in the referral and selectionprocess. KNOWLEDGE,SKILLS, AND ABILITIES (KSA) 1. Knowledge of fundamental cost and economic analysisconcepts. 2. Knowledge of acquisition requirements, and thedevelopment and approval processes used in large organizations. 3. Practical understanding of models and estimatingrelationships. 4. Ability to develop and utilize data collection techniquesand to analyze data. 5. Ability to communicate orally and in writing. 6.Ability to interact effectively with others. HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED: Once the application process is complete, a review of your application will be made to ensure you meet the job requirements. To determine if you are qualified for this job, a review of your resume and supporting documentation will be made and compared against your responses to the occupational questionnaire. The numeric rating you receive is based on your responses to the questionnaire. The score is a measure of the degree to which your background matches the knowledge, skills and abilities required of this position.  Errors or omissions may affect your rating. If qualified, we will then place you in one of the three categories described below: A. Best-qualified category. Bachelors/Masters Degree in Operations Research, with an overall GPA of 3.5 or higher. B. Highly-qualified category. Bachelors/Masters Degree in Operations Research, with an overall GPA between 3.0 and 3.45. C. Qualified category. Bachelor's degree in Operations Research; or at least 24 semester hours in a combination of Operations Research, Mathematics, Probability, Statistics, Mathematical Logic, Science, or subject matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level Mathematics or Statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester hours must have been in calculus, and have documented Superior Academic Achievement (SAA) at the undergraduate level; OR one year of graduate level education in the fields such as those described above; OR Associate?s Degree with one one-year (12 months) of specialized experience at the next lower qualifying pay band or equivalent under the General Schedule (GS) or other pay systems. Equivalent experience is defined as knowledge of utilizing statistical techniques and developing mathematical models in order to define and analyze problems, and advising officials of different approaches as a basis for management plans and decisions. This experience is equivalent to at least the GS-05 level in the Federal service, which could have been obtained in the private or public sectors. Applicants in the Best-qualified category will be referred to the selecting official for further review. BENEFITS: Department of the Air Force offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes, in part, paid vacation, sick leave, holidays and a 401K-type retirement plan. For more information, visit: http://www.usajobs.gov/ResourceCenter/Index/Interactive/Benefits#icc Relocation Benefits: Nonfederal selectees will receive limited government paid relocation benefits; i.e., first duty move. Selectees who are current Federal civilian employees will receive permanent-change-of-station (PCS) entitlements. Details regarding entitlements will be provided at time of employment offer. All Federal employees are required by Public Law 104-134 to have federal payments made by Direct Deposit. This position will be filled on a full-time permanent basis. Upon completing any required probationary period, the position will be permanent. This position requires completion of a one year probationary period. OTHER INFORMATION: Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, who are 18 but not yet 26 years old, must be registered with the Selective Service System (or have an exemption) to be eligible for federal employment. For additional information, click here . Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP): For information on how to apply as an ICTAP eligible click here . To be well-qualified and exercise selection priority for this vacancy, displaced Federal employees must be rated at 90 or above on the rating criteria for this position. Employed Annuitants (Reemployed Annuitants) : Applicants in receipt of an annuity based on civilian employment in the Federal Service are subject to the DoD Policy on The Employment of Annuitants.   Click here for more information. You can apply for a non-competitive appointment if you meet the basic eligibility requirements and you are eligible for special appointment such as those authorized for the severely disabled; certain Vietnam era and disabled veterans; returned volunteers from the Peace Corps or Vista , etc. Please indicate the type of special appointment you are seeking, if any, on your application and follow all other instructions for applying shown in this announcement. reCRUITMENT incentive may OR may not be authorized. STUDENT LOAN REPAYMENT PROGRAM (SLRP) MAY BE OFFERED FOR ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES. DIRECT DEPOSIT : All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. You must upload/submit all required documents in order to be considered, i.e., Resume, All transcripts (we will accept unofficial), (DD 214, Veterans Award Letter and SF 15 if applicable). HOW TO APPLY: To apply for this position, you must provide both of the following: 1. Your responses to the Qualifications Questionnaire . Once the online questionnaire is received you will receive an acknowledgment email that your submission was successful.  If further evaluation or interviews are required you will be contacted), AND 2. Your resume and any other documents specified in the Required Documents section of this job announcement such as transcripts and Veterans' Preference documentation (utilize SF 15 with revision date of August 2008). REMINDER: Ensure each job entry reflects beginning and ending month & year dates and the total hours worked per week (e.g. 05/2000 - 05/2006 40 hrs per week). Resumes that do not provide this basic information will be disqualified. To apply for this position, you must provide a complete Application Package, which includes both of the following: 1. Your responses to the Qualifications Questionnaire, and 2. Your résumé and any other documents specified in the Required Documents section of this job announcement. Use Application Manager for convenience and quickest processing. Track your progress to a Complete Application Package using the My Application Packages checklist and status displays in Application Manager. Your Application Package status must be Complete by 11:59PM Eastern Time on Friday, September 30, 2016 . Option A: Application Manager To begin , choose one of these options: · If your résumé is going to come from the USAJOBS Resume Builder , begin the process by clicking the Apply Online button near the bottom of this page. Your résumé will be attached only to the Application Package you complete and submit immediately after you click the Apply Online button for this job announcement, not to any Application Packages you may already have created. · If your résumé is going to be one you prepared outside of USAJOBS Résumé Builder , click this link to begin the process: Online Questionnaire If you are faxing any documents, always use the official cover sheet which you may print using this link, : http://staffing.opm.gov/pdf/usascover.pdf . The fax number is 478-757-3144 To return to Application Manager at any time, use whichever link you used to begin as described above, or simply go to https://ApplicationManager.gov . If you are experiencing difficulty accessing Application Manager you may send an email to ApplicationManagerHelpDesk@opm.gov or visit the following web-site http://eshelp.opm.gov/robo/projects/appman001/getting_more_help.htm . Option B: Paper Qualifications Questionnaire If it is not possible for you to use Application Manager , you can write your answers on paper. Follow these steps: 1. P rint a copy of this job announcement so you can read the questions offline. 2. Obtain and print a copy of the OPM Form 1203-FX, which you will use to provide your answers. You can obtain the form at this URL http://www.opm.gov/Forms/pdf_fill/OPM1203fx.pdf or by calling USAJOBS by Phone at (703) 724-1850; after the introduction, press 1, and listen for instructions. 3. You may submit the Form 1203-FX, resume, and any supporting documents by fax. · By Fax: If you are faxing a Form 1203-FX, do not use a separate cover sheet. Simply make sure the Form 1203-FX is on top of any other documents you are faxing. If you are faxing any documents without the Form 1203-FX on top, always use the official cover sheet which is here -- http://staffing.opm.gov/pdf/usascover.pdf -- and be sure to fill it out completely and clearly. The fax number is 1-478-757-3144. Feed all documents into your fax machine top first so that we receive them right-side up. Instructions for completing the paper Qualifications Questionnaire: If you are applying to this announcement by completing the OPM 1203-FX form instead of using the Online Qualifications Questionnaire method, you will need to print the vacancy announcement and refer to it as you answer the questions. You may omit any optional information; however, you must provide responses to all required questions. Be sure to double check your application before submission. You are encouraged to complete the Qualifications Questionnaire and submit your documentation using the online method since it is the most efficient way to process your application . The method that we highly recommend is outlined under " OPTION A ." REQUIRED DOCUMENTS: The following documents are REQUIRED and MUST BE submitted by the closing date of the announcement. ·          Current Resume - For qualifications determination, your resume must contain hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., HRS per week and month/year to month/year or month/year to present).  Resumes that do not contain this information will be marked as insufficient and applicants may not receive consideration for this position. ·          Transcripts (unofficial copies are acceptable; however, if selected, official transcripts are required). ·          Veteran's Preference documentation: DD214, Statement of Service (in lieu of DD 214 if currently active duty), VA letter, SF-15 if claiming 10 point preference, if applicable ·          Online Application (Questionnaire) ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS: The VOW Act Chapter 21 of Title 5, United States Code (U.S.C.), Section
2108a, requires Federal agencies treat active duty service member as veterans,
disabled veterans, and preference eligible, when they submit, at the time they
apply for a Federal job, a ?certification? of active service in lieu of a
DD214, assuming the service member is otherwise eligible. A ?certification? letter should be on
letterhead of the appropriate military branch of the service and contain (1)
the military service dates including the expected discharge or release date;
and (2) the character of service. The
service member's military service dates are necessary in order to determine
whether he or she meets the definition of "veteran" under 5 U.S.C.
2108(1). The "certification"
must reflect the service member is expected to be discharged or released from
active duty service in the armed forces under honorable conditions not later
than 120 days after the date of submission. The ?certification? must be signed by, or by direction of, the adjutant,
personnel officer, or commander of your unit or higher headquarters and must
indicate when your terminal leave will begin (if applicable), your rank, dates
of active duty service, the type of discharge and character of service (i.e.
honorable). Further, under paragraph (h)
of the rule, agencies are required to verify a qualifying separation from
military service prior to appointment, through the DD214 or other appropriate
documentation. Your preference and/or
appointment eligibility will be verified prior to appointment. Active duty members that fail to provide a
valid ?certification? of service with their initial application will be found
?not eligible?. Military members may be
appointed before the effective date of their military retirement/separation if
member is on terminal leave. To be considered, you must submit all required supporting documentation mentioned in this vacancy announcement, and all vacancy applications submitted electronically or via fax must be submitted and received by 11:59 pm ET on the closing date of this announcement.  You are not required to submit official documents at this time; copies are acceptable. WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT: Electronic submission is the quickest and easiest option. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - R&D TECHNICIAN - Gypsum (041149) Job Description R&D TECHNICIAN - Gypsum - 041149 Who is Georgia-Pacific? Watch to find out! A Day In The Life: The R&D Technicians will work under the direction of the Research & Development Laboratory staff. Assignments typically are in the areas of processing and characterizing inorganic materials to develop and/or improve gypsum products (commercial and residential gypsum panels, specialty gypsum, etc.), etc.). Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: Production of laboratory and pilot scale quantities of experimental materials Measurement and calculation of recipes Fabrication and testing or of test wall assemblies Collect test data, apply basic statistics, graph, and interpret results Characterization of materials via physical, mechanical, and analytical testing Support R&D Scientists and Engineers in trials and 3rd party validation testing by detailed process tracking and report generation Written and verbal communication/presentation of results What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications - What we absolutely require to consider you for this position: High School Diploma or equivalent Associate Degree or a quality certification required. A Bachelor’s Degree or higher preferred. A minimum of one (1) year of hands-on experience measuring and observing laboratory processes Basic construction experience, including the use of handheld power tools Experience with laboratory equipment, including bench chemistry, analytical equipment, pilot equipment Experience using a computer for record-keeping, documentation, and reporting, including experience with Microsoft Word and Excel, and the ability to learn various PC-based analytical applications Capable of building wood and steel frame test walls Must be able and willing to work in an industrial environment, including periods of time in dusty, noisy, non-air conditioned or unheated areas Must be able and willing to work safely, including wearing and using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE Knowledge, Skills and Abilities that will help you be successful: Knowledge of general safe work practices Knowledge of construction techniques Good oral and written communication skills Effective interpersonal and leadership skills Good organizing, planning, and observation skills Mechanical problem solving abilities Why Work For GP? A culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance Opportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the world Encouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledge Responsibilities and rewards based on contributions Continued company growth due to reinvesting 90% of our earnings Competitive pay and benefits that help you manage your personal and financial wellness Want to learn more about Georgia-Pacific? Georgia-Pacific and its subsidiaries are among the world's leading manufacturers and marketers of tissue, paper-based packaging, office papers, cellulose, specialty fibers, non-woven fabrics, building products and related chemicals. Our familiar consumer brands include: Quilted Northern®, Angel Soft®, Brawny®, enMotion®, Sparkle®, Mardi Gras®, and Vanity Fair®, as well as the Dixie® brand of disposable cups, plates and cutlery. Its Harmon subsidiary is among the world's largest recyclers of paper, metal and plastics. The company employs approximately 35,000 people directly. Salary and benefits commensurate with experience. We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. title: Quantitative Finance Analyst C++ Developer
summary: Bank of America is looking for a highly skilled C++ developer to join the Consumer Retail Analytics team in the Global Risk Analytics organization....
post_text: Bank Of America Job - Quantitative Finance Analyst C++ Developer , Atlanta, GA; Westlake Village, CA; NEW YORK, NY; Charlotte, NC;  - United States Skip to main content Menu Navigation Home Our Company with submenu Our Company with submenu Overview Our Business Working Here with submenu Working Here with submenu Overview Culture, Inclusion, People Military & Veterans Benefits & Advantages Career Development & Learning Recruitment Tips Locations Career Areas Search Jobs Events Applicants with Disabilities Change Location Change Location Argentina Australia Bahamas Bahrain Belgium Brazil Canada Cayman Islands Chile China Colombia Costa Rica France Germany Greece Hong Kong India Indonesia Ireland Isle of Man Israel Italy Japan Jersey Lebanon Luxembourg Malaysia Mexico Monaco Netherlands Norway Panama Peru Philippines Poland Portugal Russia Saudi Arabia Singapore South Africa South Korea Spain Sweden Switzerland Taiwan Thailand Turkey United Arab Emirates United Kingdom United States Uruguay Venezuela Search Jobs Quantitative Finance Analyst C++ Developer Atlanta, GA; Westlake Village, CA; NEW YORK, NY; Charlotte, NC;  - United States Job number: 16017064 Back to job search results Apply Now for this job > Job description Bank of America is looking for a highly skilled C++ developer to join the Consumer Retail Analytics team in the Global Risk Analytics organization. The team produces, supports and runs econometric models for mortgages, credit cards, vehicle loans and deposit overdrafts. These models are used for valuation, risk management, capital and liquidity planning, stress testing, underwriting and other strategic or day-to-day decision-making purposes. The work is fast-paced and intellectually challenging, and the team has frequent interactions with senior bank management and regulatory agencies to continuously improve our models and adapt to changing market and regulatory needs. Candidates need not have previous finance experience but will be expected to quickly develop acumen and intuition for financial risk models. Candidates will build their advanced programming skills and work with staff in Corporate Investments, Balance Sheet Management, Model Risk Management and internal/external audit. Responsibilities include: Supporting model users and assisting in development of production processes Designing and implementing flexible, maintainable, correct and efficient C++ code Studying and understanding technical model documents from team of statisticians Updating C++ and configuration files to match new/updated credit/prepayment/cash flow models Testing and debugging code to ensure correctness over wide range of inputs Reviewing, refactoring and optimizing existing code Participating in peer code reviews and collaborative development with other developers and quantitative finance analysts Qualifications Required Skills: Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Finance, Math, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science) 3 years professional experience writing maintainable and efficient C++ Strong mathematical skills, including statistics, calculus and linear algebra Extensive experience with object oriented design, STL and templates Strong attention to detail Unit/regression testing Ability to visualize and manipulate data using Excel Good verbal/written communication skills Willingness to learn and share knowledge Comfort in working in a team environment Desired Skills: Experience using Perl/Python/Lua/R/awk/SAS/SQL Linux/Unix shell scripting Source control experience (SVN preferred, but Perforce/Git/etc useful) Experience in competing risk models, financial theory, economics, derivatives pricing, stochastic calculus or machine learning. Experience of Monte Carlo Simulation Experience with parallel/cluster computing (using PVM, SLURM, MapReduce, Hadoop, etc) Experience working with very large data sets Experience with performance optimization and profilers (gprof, VTune etc) Ability to multitask and properly prioritize multiple projects Posting Date : 04/04/2016 Location : US-GA-Atlanta, US-CA-Westlake Village, US-NY-NEW YORK, US-NC-Charlotte Travel : No Full / Part-time : Fulltime Hours Per Week : 40.00 Shift : 1st Shift Already have a candidate profile? post_text: Software Engineer - CTISL 1075 - Georgia Tech Research Institute Software Engineer - CTISL 1075 Job Number: 1075 Job Classification: Research Faculty Areas of Expertise: CyberSecurity Functional Roles: Software Design/Dev; System Engineering Degree: Bachelor's Level of Experience: Entry Level; Junior Field of Study: Computer Science; Electrical Engineering Rank: Research Engineer I (REI); Research Engineer II  (REII); Research Scientist I  (RSI); Research Scientist II  (RSII) Location: Atlanta, GA Job Type: Full Time Close Date: 12/01/2016 Labs/Support Units: Cyber Technology and Information Security Laboratory (CTISL) Description: Title: Software Engineer PVA# Position: Full Time Level: Research Engineer/Scientist I/II Primary Location: Atlanta, GA Travel Required: Minimal Lab: Cyber Technology and Information Security Lab (CTISL) Reporting To: ETCM Division Job Description The Software Developer will perform applied research on sponsored programs targeted at information security and network defense, and participate in internal R&D (IRAD) associated with tool sets designed to probe and defend information repositories and networks.  The Software Developer will also be expected to support conferences, sponsor briefings, participate in delivering content associated with short courses and CTISL’s education initiatives and other activities in support of our outreach activities. Requirements Education: BS in computer science, electrical engineering, or related technical field, MS or PhD preferred. Experience: Candidate must possess 1-2 years professional experience in the information security domain or equivalent classroom / internship experience. Skills: Comprehensive knowledge of emerging threats and information security topics. Candidate must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrated knowledge in automating complex tasks using high-level scripting languages is a must. Candidate must exhibit a strong grasp of programming languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java. Experience in data analytics, distributed data processing, and machine learning is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. Current, industry-recognized certifications (CISSP, GIAC) or the ability to become certified within one year of hire is critical. Certified Information Security System Professional (CISSP) a plus. Other: Candidate must be a US citizen capable of holding a Top Secret DoD Security clearance, active clearance a major plus.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to be part of a dynamic, rapidly growing company, then we want to hear from you. Email your resume, cover letter and salary expectations to careers@idology.com . Available Opportunities in Atlanta, Ga.: Marketing Specialist Director of Business Development Assistant Product Manager Client Solutions Consultant Java Developer Office Assistant Enterprise Sales Manager – Financial Services/Insurance Data Analyst Fraud Analyst Technical Writer Software Development Manager Marketing Specialist IDology is seeking a Marketing Specialist to manage marketing activities supporting multiple solutions across multiple vertical markets including financial services, healthcare, insurance and government. Primary responsibilities will be the creation, execution and optimization of lead generation marketing campaigns and demand generation activities that integrate multiple channels including email, web, search, webinars events and more. This desired candidate will work closely with functional team members in public relations and events to build and drive campaigns. This position reports to the Director of Marketing and will collaborate with all divisions including sales and product management to deliver campaigns that meet marketing and revenue goals. The ideal (or successful) candidate will have experience creating demand generation campaigns for a B2B organization, be able to collaborate with a team, and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to be hands on with various marketing automation and sales enablement tools is important and demonstrated experience with them is required. Additionally, the desired candidate will be able to understand market segmentation and create programs to deliver IDology’s value proposition to multiple audiences. RESPONSIBILITIES Research, develop and support lead list generation initiatives that support sales and marketing objectives Create clear, compelling content that demonstrates deep knowledge and understanding of the business’s solutions and markets and is consistent with the company positioning and brand identity Coordinate digital and search marketing programs Execute lead generation and nurturing activities to support sales goals. Implement demand generation and visibility programs including: email campaigns, PR, PPC and organic search campaigns, traditional marketing campaigns and more to produce high quality leads Measure, track, analyze, and regularly report on the effectiveness of overall demand generation; create projections and measure ROI. Work closely with sales and other internal parties as needed to ensure strategic alignment. Assist in overall marketing planning and evaluate ongoing opportunities to create a sound, cost-effective strategy. BASIC REQUIREMENTS BA in Communications, Journalism, Marketing or related disciplines 2+ years B2B marketing experience with focus in technology B2B marketing preferred 2+ years of digital marketing experience with the understanding of both traditional and digital marketing programs 2+ years of campaign delivery experience with the ability to provide an example of responsibility for campaign execution from start to completion, including budgeting. 2+ years experience with lead nurturing processes, email marketing and marketing automation solutions such as eTrigue or similar applications 2+ years reporting and CRM experience, preferably with Salesforce Working knowledge of paid and organic search with the ability to communicate effectively with external SEO partner Possess strong research and investigative skills with the ability to balance between creative and analytical thinking Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset Positive and enthusiastic with good interpersonal skills and the ability to work well independently or in a team environment Highly motivated, organized, detail-oriented and autonomous self-starter who takes initiative and has the ability to thrive and problem solve under tight deadlines Committed to excellence and high standards Back to the Top Director of Business Development We are seeking a Director of Business Development who will be responsible for generating new sources of revenue by creating and supporting relationships with new partners. This is an exciting role which will have a major contributory impact to the revenue growth of the company. The role will work closely with the VP of Business Development. RESPONSIBILITIES Generate new sources of revenue via business development activities in the assigned markets which can include software, consulting firm, and systems integrators Hunt and develop new opportunities and channels of revenue via OEMs, resellers, and other strategic partner relationships Develop a comprehensive and aligned business development plan Identity, develop, recommend, and implement sales strategies for new target accounts and markets Demonstrate IDology’s software solution in detail, define applications, and articulate key benefits for targeted account applications REQUIREMENTS Proven success selling and building strategic partnerships and channel relationships in the software industry Must have demonstrated entrepreneurial success in working in fast paced environments and with high growth organizations Must be a self-starter, fast learner, and possess the business acumen to articulate benefits of IDology’s identity verification and fraud prevention services for potential partner applications Ability to independently and aggressively identify new prospect opportunities in the assigned targeted markets and accounts, and drive them to closure Consultative selling and training and experience Experience in selling fraud prevention, risk, compliance, security software solutions and tools is a plus Business, MBA, or engineering degree a plus Travel required Position based in Atlanta Back to the Top Assistant Product Manager We are seeking a talented, hardworking, entrepreneurial employee with 1 – 3+ years of experience in software marketing and/or product management to fill our Assistant Product Manager position. The Assistant Product Manager will work with the VP of Products and other Assistant Product Managers to increase the profitability of existing products and develop new products for the company. The Assistant Product Manager will help build products from existing ideas and help to develop new ideas based on industry experience and interaction with customers and prospects. The Assistant Product Manager must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. He/she will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. Additionally, he/she will work with marketing communications to define the go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. Responsibilities: Assist in managing the product line lifecycle from strategic planning to tactical activities Write Product Specifications Understand regulations that impact the product solution both domestic and international Specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers Requirements: 1 to 3+ years of software marketing/product management experience Core competences: computer products knowledge, logistical knowledge of promotional efforts, market development skills, and MS Office Knowledge of technology industry is required Must be a self-starter and proactive Commitment to excellence and high standards Excellent written and verbal communication skills Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions Creative, flexible, and innovative team player Demonstrated ability to make successful presentations to individuals and/or groups at all levels of an organization Strong organizational skills; able to manage priorities and workflow This position requires travel to customer and non-customer sites in North America and Europe Back to the Top Client Solutions Consultant The Client Solutions Consultant will be on the front-line of communications with customers, advising solutions to their application needs. This is a consultative role with the Ideal candidate being personable, intuitive and analytical with an outgoing personality and the ability to build a strong rapport with customers while providing user training and solutions for client support requirements. RESPONSIBILITIES Assume pre and post sales activities by managing relationships directly with customers installing or integrating our services Configuring client business objectives to meet technical requirements Manage technical integration interaction and provide ongoing support Troubleshooting systems and performance issues over the phone and Internet. Analyze software performance and client usage Contribute to customer use of software documentation and training materials Train and support customers Provide 24X7 on call support, as needed BASIC REQUIREMENTS Recent Graduate with Bachelor’s Degree, 3.0 GPA or higher with the desire to grow career in Client Solutions OR Military Experience with the desire to grow career in Client Solutions OR 3+ years Account Management AND/OR IT Support experience. Proficient in Microsoft Windows and Office, specifically Excel Highly motivated, independent worker with an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong comfort level in embarking on unfamiliar tasks. Must have professional phone skills, a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Strong analytical, oral and written communication skills. Strong Multi-tasking and Organizational skills Ability to be on call for 1 week each month. Good working knowledge of the Internet and networks Travel – under 10% DESIRED Previous experience in a help desk or technical support environment Previous experience working in a Technology company Previous working experience with Tableau Software Implementation/Installation experience Back to the Top Java Developer SUMMARY Developer will be a member of a small team focused on developing and deploying commercial Web services.  Projects will involve enhancing existing products and developing new products built on the Java/JEE platform.  Our applications are developed using Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, and Spring. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate with Product Management team to create innovative identity verification and fraud detection services. Interface with Quality Assurance team to ensure bug-free deliverables. Provide input on estimates and progress to Project Manager to ensure timely delivery. Develop and maintain efficient, high-quality web applications using your preferred IDE and following our SDLC process. Follow secure software development practices, paying particular attention to the OWASP Top 10. Create and maintain unit/integration test cases using our in-house automated testing tool. BASIC REQUIREMENTS 5+ years of software development experience 2+ years’ experience with Java 2+ years’ experience with XML 2+ years’ experience with SQL Excellent written communication skills DESIRED Bachelor’s degree, in a technical discipline or related field 10+ years of software development experience Experience writing and deploying Web services Ability to write build scripts with Ant Experience working with an MVC framework like Spring (preferred), Struts, or Webwork. Experience working with PHP Back to the Top Office Assistant SUMMARY As IDology’s Office Assistant, you will perform a variety of tasks and ensure that employees and visitors enjoy a great work environment. This is a part-time position. RESPONSIBILITIES Daily office operations, including ordering supplies, inventory management and managing mail/deliveries Coordinate the on-boarding process for new employees, ensuring a smooth transition and warm welcome to the IDology family Greet visitors and ensure that security protocols are follow Manage various tasks/projects as assigned Answer the phone Filing Maintain office equipment and facilities and coordinate any repair issues Head the social committee and plan and execute company events BASIC REQUIREMENTS Excellent written and verbal communication skills Computer savvy and open to learning new applications Competency with business software such as: Microsoft Office Professional Suite, Adobe Acrobat, etc. Good attention to detail Great team player Customer service driven with the ability to develop relationships with both internal and external personnel A desire to show initiative Work proactively and independently Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet and professional manner Positive, professional, up-beat personality Demonstrated stable employment background and references At least 3 years of work experience in an office setting in an administrative capacity DESIRED College Degree Back to the Top Enterprise Sales Manager – Financial Services/Insurance IDology, a leader in multi-layered identity verification and fraud prevention solutions and named one of this year’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work for® in Atlanta, is looking for a high energy intelligent sales executive to fill a hunter role within our high growth organization. The Enterprise Sales Manager will identify, build and grow strategic relationships with key decision makers with large FIs and Insurance organizations. Expectations for this position include understanding and navigating the sales process in large complex organizations, building and growing a strong pipeline, deep knowledge of IDology’s identity and fraud solutions, closing enterprise level deals and expanding business within these accounts. Responsibilities: Build and develop multi-million dollar pipeline of enterprise level accounts Develop relationships within those accounts and grow the business Forecast new business at a high level of accuracy Learn and develop a deep understanding of IDology solutions Use Salesforce.com to manage the sales process Attend all company sponsored training sessions and apply learned techniques and new products to sales opportunities Continually stay abreast of new product offers, emerging technologies and market drivers. Travel nationally to present and develop relationships Requirements: Position is based in Atlanta, GA Bachelor’s degree and 7-10 years successful sales experience Successful experience selling Fintech SaaS solutions within the financial and insurance verticals Strong computer and web proficiency including experience with Word, Excel and Salesforce.com or other web based sales automation tools Excellent oral and written communication skills Experience with technology and solution based sales Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently as well as in a fast paced team environment Experience in fraud and identity a plus Highly Motivated drive for success Excellent inter-personal and inter-departmental skills Back to the Top Data Analyst The Data Analyst will play an instrumental role in building and providing integrated analysis and ad-hoc reports for our business. Responsibilities: Execute ad-hoc queries to rapidly extract information and generate reports Validate report results to ensure they are accurate and complete Automate ad-hoc queries to schedule on-going reports Apply problem-solving skills to analyze data to result in actionable business improvement recommendations, organize analytic findings into clear, concise written and verbal communications Conduct advanced data analysis to identify trends using data mining algorithms and alert the management on risk and opportunity Perform root cause and impact analysis to investigate issues and make recommendations for potential solutions Effective prioritization and management of multiple requests, including often and proactive communications of time-lines, status, and escalations of issues Analyze software performance and client usage Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data Analyze and problem solve issues with current customers. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data. Work with Sales team in pre-sales activities to perform correlation studies for prospects. Perform monthly review of top customers. Perform quarterly review of mid-tier customers. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings Create and present quality dashboards Requirements: Bachelor’s in Information Management, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields 5+ years of data analytics experience including data models, data mining, database design and segmentation techniques Proven technical skills in data manipulation and analysis with the ability to present complex information and recommendations in a variety of formats and in an understandable and compelling manner. Proven skill-set to write, optimize, and automate SQL queries in both Oracle and Teradata environments Highly proficient in data analysis tools and report development (e.g. – Excel, Access, Tableau) with a strong preference for Tableau Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Proven ability to ensure that quality and timeliness of measurement deliverables meet client expectations Exceptional attention to detail with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Good interpersonal skills with ability to work well in a team environment Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand with the ongoing sense of curiosity and desire to learn something new. Desired Skills and Expertise: 7+ years of data analytics experience including data models, data mining, database design and segmentation techniques. Ability to write, optimize, and automate Hive queries from an Hadoop environment Experience in working with analyzing app or web usage data Experience with analyzing and validating data using Omniture and Splunk Back to the Top Fraud Analyst The Fraud Analyst will be responsible for review and analysis of accounts to detect fraudulent activity.  The ideal candidate will possess Solid decision-making skills, problem solving skills and sound judgment. Responsibilities: Identifying, analyzing and interpreting fraud-like trends or patterns in data. Report trends and findings to executive team and to the client. Provide expertise to manage, manipulate, and analyze data and report results. Analyze software performance and client usage Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data Analyze and problem-solve issues with current customers. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings Create and present quality dashboards Generate routine and ad hoc reports Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Statistics or related field with 3+ years of analytical experience in data, fraud, or audit. Experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate Experience with Tableau or other analytic software tools Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development. Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand. Strong analytic, oral and written communication skills with the ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner. Must have professional phone skills, a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy Desired Skills and Expertise: 5+ years of analytical experience in data, fraud, or auditing Familiarity with investigative tools, public and private records databases, and fraud investigations. Knowledge of statistics Back to the Top Technical Writer Summary IDology is seeking a technical writer to produce high-quality documentation that contributes to successful client integrations. Primary responsibilities include writing documentation for new initiatives and keeping documentation for existing products current. Position will be creating documentation for computer hardware engineers, software developers and data scientists. Responsibilities Collaborate with the product managers to develop innovative documentation for new and existing products. Study product specifications to determine the technical documentation needs and deliver easy to understand user application and developer guides. Create video tutorials to help end-users navigate system settings and applications. Create and maintain the documentation architecture and style. Create sharable diagrams, wireframes and charts to increase user and development teams understanding of solution. Develop and maintain intranet of supporting documentation for internal IDology teams. Support Sales and Business Development by studying and delivering winning responses to Request for Proposals (RFP) and similar procurement mechanisms. Exceptional ability to communicate technical concepts. Policy creation and documentation of Employee Policy Manual, redefining and reinterpreting into updated layout. Creation of Resource Center Materials including development of Videos and Tutorials. Basic  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field. 5+ years’ experience in writing on technical subject matter, preferably in a similar field. 2+ years’ experience with XML, Java or similar programming language. Experienced in revising documentation for internal teams and policies, RFP Support and technical wireframes external use. Must have professional oral and written communication skills with a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical details effectively. Good interpersonal skills with ability to work well in a team environment Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand with the ongoing sense of curiosity and desire to learn something new. Committed to excellence and high standards. Back to the Top Software Development Manager SUMMARY We are looking for a Software Development Manager who will bring their people management skills and technical experience to lead our company’s software development efforts. This is a key leadership role and responsible for delivery our most strategic technical projects, designing new software systems, and has primary responsibility for development deliverables and deadlines.  Projects will involve enhancing existing products and developing new products built on the Java/JEE platform. Our applications are developed using Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, and Spring. The successful candidate should exhibit relentless quality standards, strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to work with others, build teams, develop talent, lead by example and have passion and discipline on operational excellence. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide leadership and direction to a team of 9 developers while assigning projects and managing resource allocation Provide input to senior management on estimated task duration, technical information and issue resolution Partner with VP of Development to evolve and develop the team vision and strategy Manage talent acquisition process for development team and facilitate performance management reviews. Provide development of training materials along with training coaching and mentoring, Define and oversee work on tasks required to implement architectural decisions Establish and implement new processes and tools to drive efficiencies Hands-On Development and coding BASIC REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree, in a technical discipline or related field 10+ years of software development experience 2+ years leading or managing a team of developers. 5+ years’ experience with Java, XML and SQL experience Experience working with an MVC framework like Spring (preferred), Struts, or Webwork. Experience writing and deploying Web services (AWS preferred) Ability to write build scripts with Ant Experience working with PHP Communicate proactively on identified issues, updating status, and analyzing and reporting on alternative design solutions. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences. Good interpersonal skills with ability to work well in a team environment Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand with the ongoing sense of curiosity and desire to learn something new.
